loans.name: João

texts.pt:
Divorciado e pai de 3 filhos, apenas 1 frequenta a Escola, vive na casa própria e sustenta sua meã enviando algum valor monetário para ajudar nas despesas correntes.
É reformado e recebe pensão e com o presente empréstimo pretende comprar material de construção (janelas, porta, cimento, areia, pedra, porta, e outros) para dar continuidade com a ampliação da sua casa. 
No futuro deseja concluir e mobilar a sua casa e formar uma família, para tal compromete-se a pagar devidamente o empréstimo para solicitar mais a Hluvuku. 
O desafio é arranjar uma fonte de rendimento para acrescentar a sua receita e conseguir manter se saudável.
texts.en:
João is divorced and the father of 3 children, only 1 of whom attends School, lives in his own house and supports his mother by sending her some money to help with ongoing expenses.

He's retired and receives a pension. With this loan he plans to buy construction material (windows, doors, cement, sand, stone and others) to continue the building work on his house.

In future he hopes to complete and furnish his house and have a family. To this end he commits to duly paying off the loan so as to solicit further loans from Hluvuku.

His challenge is to find a source of income to add to his current one and to manage to maintain his health.

loans.use: buy construction material (windows, doors, cement, sand, stone and others) to continue the building work on his house.

loans.name: Foroque

texts.pt:
Casado e pai de 4 filhos dos quais 2 frequentam a Escola, vive na casa própria e não sustenta mais ninguém.
É segurança e negociante na venda de produtos alimentares. Com o presente empréstimo pretende comprar produtos (óleo, caldo, arroz. Farinha de milho, e outros) para aumentar a quantidade da sua mercadoria. 
No futuro deseja concluir e construção da sua casa, para tal compromete-se a pagar devidamente o empréstimo para solicitar mais a Hluvuku. 
O desafio é conseguir manter se saudável.
texts.en:
Foroque is married and the father of 4 children - 2 of whom attend School - lives in his own house and doesn't support anyone else.

He's a security guard and a trader selling foodstuffs. With this loan he plans to buy products (oil, stock, rice, corn flour and others) to increase the quantity of his stock.

In future, Foroque hopes to complete the construction of his house. To this end he commits to duly paying off the loan so as to solicit further loans from Hluvuku.

His challenge is to stay healthy.

loans.use: buy products (oil, stock, rice, corn flour and others) to increase the quantity of his stock.

loans.name: Assucena

texts.pt:
Casada e mãe de 2 filhos que frequentam a Escola, vive na casa própria e sustenta mais 3 sobrinhos que vivem com ela.
É docente e quadro do Ministério da Educação e com o presente empréstimo pretende comprar material de construção (cimento, ferro, areia, pedra, e outros) para dar continuidade a obra da sua casa. 
No futuro deseja concluir e mobilar a sua casa, para tal compromete-se a pagar devidamente o empréstimo para solicitar mais a Hluvuku. 
O desafio é a insuficiência de fundos para realizar todos seus projectos.
texts.en:
Assucena is married and the mother of 2 children who attend School. She lives in her own house and supports 3 nephews who live with her.

She's a teacher and a permanent employee of the Ministry of Education and with this loan she plans to buy construction material (cement, iron, sand, stone and others) to continue the building work on her house.

In future, Assucena wishes to complete and furnish her house. To this end she commits to duly paying off the loan so as to solicit further loans from Hluvuku.

Her challenge is the lack of funds to carry out all her projects.

loans.use: buy construction material (cement, iron, sand, stone and others) to continue the building work on her house.

loans.name: Acácio

texts.pt:
Casado e pai de 3 filhos dos quais 2 frequentam a Escola, vive na casa própria e sustenta mais 4 membros da sua família enviando dinheiro para despesas correntes.
É docente e quadro do Ministério da Educação e com o presente empréstimo pretende comprar material de construção (cimento, ferro, areia, pedra, e outros) para dar continuidade a obra da sua casa. 
No futuro deseja concluir, pintar e mobilar a sua casa, para tal compromete-se a pagar devidamente o empréstimo para solicitar mais a Hluvuku. 
O desafio é manter-se saudável e a insuficiência de fundos para realizar todos seus projectos.
texts.en:
Acácio is married and the father of 3 children, 2 of whom attend School. He lives in his own house and supports 4 other members of his family by sending them money for ongoing expenses.

He's a teacher and a permanent employee of the Ministry of Education and with this loan he plans to buy construction materials (cement, iron, sand, stone and others) to continue the building work on his house.

In future Acácio hopes to complete, paint and furnish his house and to this end he commits to duly paying off the loan so as to solicit further loans from Hluvuku.

His challenges are to remain healthy and the lack of funds required to undertake all his projects.

loans.use: buy construction materials (cement, iron, sand, stone and others) to continue the building work on his house

loans.name: Alice

texts.pt:
Casada não oficialmente e mãe de 4 filhos, todos frequentam a Escola, vive na casa própria e sustenta mais 3 sobrinhos que vivem com ela.
É comerciante, possui um estaleiro de produção e venda de blocos. Com o presente empréstimo pretende comprar material (cimento e areia) para fabrico de mais blocos no seu estaleiro. 
No futuro deseja abrir um outro estaleiro de venda de blocos num lugar mais aberto e de fácil acesso aos seus clientes, para tal compromete-se a pagar devidamente o empréstimo para solicitar mais a Hluvuku. 
O desafio é a insuficiência de fundos para realizar todos seus projectos e manter-se saudável.
texts.en:
Alice is married (not officially) and the mother of 4 children who all attend School. She lives in her own house and supports 3 nephews who live with her.

She's a trader and owns a workshop producing and selling blocks [bricks]. With this loan she plans to buy raw materials (cement and sand) to produce more blocks in her workshop.

In future Alice hopes to open another workshop selling blocks in a more open area which is easier for her clients to access. To this end she commits to duly paying off the loan so as to solicit further loans from Hluvuku.

Her challenge is the lack of sufficient funds to carry out all her projects and the need to stay healthy.

loans.use: buy raw materials (cement and sand) to produce more blocks in her workshop.

loans.name: Adriano

texts.pt:
Casado e pai de 7 filhos, 1 dos quais ainda frequenta a Escola, vive na casa própria construído de material local e não sustenta mais ninguém para além de seus filhos.
Trabalha como operário agrícola no seu próprio terreno e com o presente empréstimo pretende comprar material de construção (cimento, areia, pedra, porta, e outros) para terminar com a obra da sua casa. 
No futuro deseja concluir e mobilar a sua casa e oferecer melhor conforto a sua família, para tal compromete-se a pagar devidamente o empréstimo para solicitar mais a Hluvuku. 
O desafio é conseguir manter se saudável para não ter algo que possa desviar os seus projectos
texts.en:
Adriano is married and the father of 7 children, 1 of whom still attends School. He lives in his own house built with local material and doesn't support anyone else other than his children.

He works in the agriculture industry on his own land and with this loan he plans to buy construction material (cement, sand, stone, doors and others) to finish the building work on his house.

In future he hopes to complete and furnish his house and offer his family more comfort. To this end he commits to duly paying off the loan so as to solicit further loans from Hluvuku.

His challenge is to stay healthy so that there is nothing to steer him away from his projects.

loans.use: buy construction material (cement, sand, stone, doors and others) to finish the building work on his house.

loans.name: Ilda

texts.pt:
Casada e mãe de 2 filhos, que frequentam a Escola, vive na casa própria e sustenta seu irmão que vive com ela.
É comerciante, vende produtos alimentares e com o presente empréstimo pretende comprar amendoim em grande quantidade para reforçar o seu stock. 
No futuro deseja apostar mais no seu negócio construindo uma banca mais grande, para tal compromete-se a pagar devidamente o empréstimo para solicitar mais a Hluvuku. 
O desafio é concluir o seu curso de medicina que foi sempre seu grande sonho.
texts.en:
Ilda is married and the mother of 2 children who attend School, lives in her own house and supports her brother who lives with her.

She's a trader who sells food products and with this loan she plans to buy peanuts in great quantities to reinforce her stock.

In future, Ilda wants to bet more on her business by building a larger stall. To this end she commits to duly paying off her loan in order to request further loans from Hluvuku.

Her challenge is to complete her medical degree which has always been her big dream.

loans.use: buy peanuts for resale

loans.name: Amélia

texts.pt:
Solteira e mãe de 2 filhos, que frequentam a Escola, vive na casa própria e sustenta seu neto que vive com ela.
É comerciante, vende produtos alimentares diversos e com o presente empréstimo pretende comprar produtos (óleo, açúcar, farinha, arroz, amendoim, peixe e outros) para aumentar a quantidade da sua mercadoria. 
No futuro deseja apostar mais no seu negócio construindo uma mercearia mais grande, para tal compromete-se a pagar devidamente o empréstimo para solicitar mais a Hluvuku. 
O desafio é apostar na educação dos filhos e conseguir levar-lhes ao ensino superior.
texts.en:
Amelia is single and the mother of 2 children who attend School, lives in her own house and supports a grandson who lives with her.

She's a trader, sells various food products and with this loan she plans to buy products (oil, sugar flour, rice, peanuts, fish and others) to increase the quantity of her stock.

In future she hopes to bet more on her business by building a bigger grocery store. To this end she commits to duly paying off the loan so as to request further loans from Hluvuku.

Her challenge is to bet on her children's education and manage to get them into higher education.

loans.use: buy products (oil, sugar flour, rice, peanuts, fish and others) to increase the quantity of her stock.

loans.name: Angela

texts.pt:
Solteira e mãe de 5 filhos, alguns ainda frequentam a Escola, vive na casa própria e sustenta sua mãe enviando algum valor para ajudar nas despesas de casa.
É comerciante, vende roupa usada diversa. Com o presente empréstimo pretende comprar fardos de roupa usada diversa para aumentar a quantidade da sua mercadoria. 
No futuro deseja procurar melhorar a sua actividade comercial abrindo um estabelecimento próprio, para tal compromete-se a pagar devidamente o empréstimo para solicitar mais a Hluvuku. 
O desafio é conseguir formar os seus filhos ate ao ensino superior.
texts.en:
Angela is single and has five children, some of whom still attend school. She lives with her family in a house she owns and also supports her mother by sending some money to help with her household expenses.
She's in retail and sells used clothing of various kinds. With the current loan she intends to purchase bundles of used clothing of various kinds in order to stock up with merchandise.
In the future she wishes to try and improve her business by opening a store of her own. For that reason she pledges to repay the loan as scheduled so she can request more loans from Hluvuku.
The challenge she faces is being able to provide her children with an education all the way through college.

loans.use: to purchase used clothing for selling.

loans.name: Mosoq Allpa Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “MOSOQ ALLPA”; Este banco se ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia Cusco  y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Lidia ella es casada y tiene 61 años y tiene 4 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de tienda de abarrotes, la socia vende diferentes tipos de productos como arroz, azúcar, leche, golosinas, gaseosas entre otros, la socia lleva años en este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia trabaja de lunes a sábado en su negocio, la socia a la vez es profesora cesante , siendo de esta forma que la socia saca adelante a su familia.

La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de mercadería como arroz y leche para su negocio.

Los otros socios  se dedican a la preparación de refrigerios, restaurante, venta de cosméticos, venta de textos escolares, trabajadores de empresa privada y pública.

La socia que sale adjunta en la foto es socia que pidió permiso para llegar tarde a la reunión por motivos de trabajo.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members belong to the “MOSOQ ALLPA” communal bank.  This communal bank is located in Cusco District, which belongs to Cusco Province and Cusco Department.

Lidia is a member of this communal bank.  She is 61 years old, married and has four children.  She divides her time between her daily activities and her grocery store business.  She sells different types of products, such as rice, sugar, milk, sweets, candies and carbonated soft drinks, among others.  She has been in this business for years, which does well for her thanks to the hard work she puts in every day.  She works from Monday to Saturday at her business, while at the same time being an off-duty teacher.  In this way she provides for her family.

Lidia is requesting this loan in order to buy merchandise such as rice and milk for her business.

The other members work preparing snacks, in restaurants, selling cosmetics, selling textbooks and in private and public companies.

The member who appears in the extra snapshot in the bottom right-hand corner of the group photo is a member who asked permission to arrive late to the meeting for work reasons.

Lidia is grateful to all those who form part of her dream in this way, and she promises to make her payments in the period established for her loan.

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as rice and milk for her business.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.es: Vilma  es La socia que pertenece al  banco comunal “PUNTUALITO” de la ciudad del Cusco – Perú. La señora Vilma  continúa trabajando y produciendo en su panadería, actividad que desarrolla hace muchos años y que ha hecho crecer con mucho trabajo y esfuerzo. Vilma  en esta oportunidad está solicitando su préstamo para invertirlo en comprar insumos como harina, azúcar, sal, levadura, pasas, etc.  y para las próximas fiestas navideñas elaborar panetones que son panes dulces de gran tamaño rellenos de pasas y fruta confitada que la gente acostumbra comer  en estas fechas. Vilma  está muy agradecida con KIVA por permitirle desarrollarse en su actividad económica, la cual representan el sustento de su familia y desarrollo de su actividad.
texts.en: Vilma’s a member of the “Puntualito” communal bank in Cusco, Peru.  She continues working baking bread, an activity she’s been in for many years and that she’s made grow thanks to much effort and work.  On this occasion, Vilma’s asking for a loan to buy ingredients like flour, sugar, salt, yeast, raisins, etc. to make panettones for the upcoming Christmas season; these are very large sweet breads filled with raisins and candied fruit that people tend to consume on these dates.  Vilma’s very grateful to KIVA for allowing her to develop in her economic activity that means support for her family and development of her activity.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, salt, yeast, raisins, etc.

loans.name: Liliana

texts.es:
La socia Liliana pertenece al banco comunal RICHARY RUNA,este banco esta ubicado en el distrito de Cusco,departamento de Cusco y provincia de Cusco.

La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de elaboracion de tamales tanto dulces como salados,la socia lleva buen tiempo en este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada dia a su negocio la socia trabaja a pedido para los distintos compromisos como matrimonios,bautizos ,fiestas de 15 años entre otros,la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa siendo de esta forma que la socia saca adelante a su familia.

La socia solicita el credito para la compra de insumos para su negocio como manteca,azucar,maiz entre otros.

La socia se siente agradecida por el credito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
Liliana belongs to the communal bank Richary Runa.  This bank is located in the Cusco District of Cusco Department, Cusco Province.

Liliana alternates her regular daily activities with her business making tamales.  She makes both sweet and savory varieties.  She has been in the business a good while.  It has been going well, thanks to the hard work she puts into it each day.  She takes orders for various events, like weddings, baptisms, "fiestas de 15 años" (a party for a young girl turning 15 years old) and other occasions.  Liliana is a responsible and hard working person, which is how she is able to help her family to get ahead.  

Liliana is requesting the loan in order to purchase supplies for her business, like butter, sugar, corn and other items. 

Liliana is grateful for the loan that has been offered, and she promises to comply with her established repayment plan.

loans.use: to purchase supplies for her business like butter, sugar, corn and other items.

loans.name: Teresa

texts.es: Teresa  es La socia que pertenece al  banco comunal “PUNTUALITO” de la ciudad del Cusco – Perú. La señora Teresa  continúa trabajando en su tienda de abarrotes, vendiendo productos de primera necesidad. Teresa  en esta oportunidad está solicitando su préstamo para invertirlo en comprar mercadería como arroz, azúcar, leche, aceite, fideos, y para esta temporada navideña gaseosas, cerveza, champagne y panetones. Teresa  está muy agradecida con KIVA por permitirle desarrollarse en su actividad económica, la cual representan el sustento de su familia y desarrollo de su actividad.
texts.en:
Teresa is a member of the communal bank "Puntualito" in Cusco, Perú, and continues to work in her grocery store selling basic products. Right now, Teresa is requesting a loan that she will use to buy products such as rice, sugar, milk, oil, and noodles as well as beer, champagne and pastries for the coming Christmas season.  

Teresa is grateful to Kiva for allowing her to develop her business, which represents the sustenance of her family and the development of her activity.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, milk, oil, noodles, sodas, beer, champagne and Christmas pastries.

loans.name: Shirley

texts.es: Shirley  es La socia que pertenece al  banco comunal “PUNTUALITO” de la ciudad del Cusco – Perú. La señora Shirley  continúa ayudando en el negocio familiar que es una panadería y paralelamente continúa en su negocio independiente de venta de comida rápida o (fast food ) como hamburguesas y sándwiches. Shirley  en esta oportunidad está solicitando su préstamo para invertirlo en comprar insumos como carne de res, papas, carne de pollo, verduras etc. para su negocio de fast food. Shirley  está muy agradecida con KIVA por permitirle desarrollarse en su actividad económica, la cual representan el sustento de su familia y desarrollo de su actividad.
texts.en: Shirley is a member of the “PUNTUALITO” communal bank in the city of Cuzco, Peru. Shirley continues to help the family business, which is a bread bakery. She also continues to work in her independent business selling fast food, such as hamburgers and sandwiches. At this time, Shirley is asking for a loan to invest in buying ingredients such as beef, chicken, vegetables, etc, for her fast food. Shirley is very grateful to KIVA for letting her develop her economic activity, which is her family's source of support.

loans.use: to buy beef, chicken, vegetables, etc.

loans.name: Edelmira

texts.es: Edelmira  es La socia que pertenece al  banco comunal “PUNTUALITO” de la ciudad del Cusco – Perú. La señora Edelmira  continúa trabajando en su tienda de abarrotes, vendiendo productos de primera necesidad. Edelmira  en esta oportunidad está solicitando su préstamo para invertirlo en comprar mercadería como arroz, azúcar, leche, aceite, fideos, y para esta temporada navideña gaseosas, cerveza, champagne y panetones. Edelmira  está muy agradecida con KIVA por permitirle desarrollarse en su actividad económica, la cual representan el sustento de su familia y desarrollo de su actividad.
texts.en:
Edelmira is a member that belongs to the communal bank “Puntualito” from the city of Cusco, Peru.

Edelmira continues working in her grocery store, selling staples.

Edelmira is now asking for a loan in order to invest in the purchase of merchandise such as rice, sugar, milk, oil, and noodles, and  sodas for the holiday season, beer, champagne and panettones. 

Edelmira is very grateful with Kiva for permitting her to develop her business which represents the livelihood of her family and the progress of her activity.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, milk, oil, noodles, sodas, beer, champagne and panettones for her grocery store.

loans.name: Irma

texts.es: Irma  es La socia que pertenece al  banco comunal “PUNTUALITO” de la ciudad del Cusco – Perú. La señora Irma  continúa trabajando en el de venta de comida rápida o (fast food ) como jugos,  hamburguesas y sándwiches y aprovechando su local también saca fotocopias. Irma  en esta oportunidad está solicitando su préstamo para invertirlo en comprar insumos como pre cocidos de res, de pollo, papas, verduras y frutas. para su negocio de fast food. Irma  está muy agradecida con KIVA por permitirle desarrollarse en su actividad económica, la cual representan el sustento de su familia y desarrollo de su actividad.
texts.en:
Irma belongs to the communal bank "Puntualito" in the city of Cusco in Peru.  She continues to work in her business selling fast food, such as hamburgers, sandwiches and juices. Additionally, she is offering photocopying services.  

She is currently seeking a loan so that she can buy beef, chicken, potatoes, fruits and vegetables for her fast food business.  She is very grateful to Kiva for helping her to develop her business, which provides sustenance to her family.

loans.use: to buy beef, chicken, potatoes, fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Joaquin

texts.es: Joaquín es el socio que pertenece al  banco comunal “PUNTUALITO” de la ciudad del Cusco – Perú. El señor Joaquín es un joven estudiante muy trabajador y emprendedor, que se dedica  a realizar estudios topográficos para la construcción de infraestructura urbana. Joaquín en esta oportunidad está solicitando su préstamo para comprar un GPS y también  pagar sus estudios universitarios de Ingeniería Civil. Joaquín está muy agradecido con KIVA por permitirle mantenerse y desarrollarse en su actividad económica, la cual representa el principal ingreso económico para el pago de su educación.
texts.en:
Joaquín belongs to the communal bank "Puntualito" in the city of Cusco in Peru.  He is a young and very hardworking student and entrepreneur.  He is studying Civil Engineering and has a business conducting topographical studies for the construction of infrastructure in an urban setting.

Currently, he is seeking a loan in order to purchase a GPS and also to help pay for his university studies.  He is very grateful to KIVA for helping him to support himself and develop his business, which is his principal source of income that allows him to pay for his education.

loans.use: to purchase a GPS and also pay for his university studies.

loans.name: Fernando

texts.es: Fernando es el socio que pertenece al  banco comunal “PUNTUALITO” de la ciudad del Cusco – Perú. El señor Fernando es muy trabajador y emprendedor, que continúa con su actividad como agente de viajes de turismo de aventura. Fernando en esta oportunidad está solicitando su préstamo para comprar sacos para dormir, cocinetas, e instrumentos de camping en general para renovar su equipo. Fernando está muy agradecido con KIVA por permitirle mantenerse y desarrollarse en su actividad económica, la cual representa el principal ingreso económico y sustento de su familia.
texts.en:
Fernando belongs to the communal bank "Puntualito" in the city of Cusco in Peru.  He is very hardworking and enterprising.  He is continuing in his business leading adventure tours.  He is currently seeking a loan so that he can buy sleeping bags, portable stoves, and other camping equipment to upgrade his inventory.

He is very grateful to KIVA for helping him to support himself and develop his business, which is his family's principal source of income.

loans.use: to buy sleeping bags, portable stoves, and other camping equipment.

loans.name: Wilber Edgardo

texts.es:
El socio  Wilbert pertenece al banco comunal “ROSITA DE LOS ANGELES”, el banco esta ubicado en el distrito de San Sebastian,provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio tiene 24 años de edad y es soltero, él socio alterna sus actividades diarias  brindando el servicio de taxi, el tiene su carrito siendo el mismo socio quien lo trabaja, a la vez el socio es técnico mecánico de la misma forma cuenta con su propia mecánica donde arregla todo tipo de carros, él socio es una persona bien emprendedora siendo de esta forma que el socio sale adelante.

El socio solicito el préstamo para comprar llantas para su carro.

El socio se siente agradecido por el  crédito otorgado y agradece a los inversionistas de kiva.
texts.en: Wilbert belongs to the “Rosita de los Angeles” communal bank located in San Sebastian District, Cusco Province and Department.  He’s 24-years-old, single and alternates his daily activities with providing taxi service.  He has his car and he drives it himself.  At the same time, he’s also a mechanic and has his own repair shop where he repairs all types of cars.  He’s quite an enterprising person who gets ahead this way.  He’s requesting the loan to buy tires for his car.  He is grateful for the granted loan and thanks KIVA lenders.

loans.use: to buy tires for his car.

loans.name: Darwin Mighail

texts.es: Darwin es el socio que pertenece al  banco comunal “PUNTUALITO” de la ciudad del Cusco – Perú. Darwin es un joven estudiante de odontología muy trabajador y emprendedor, que se dedica  trabajar en un consultorio odontológico, trabajo que le sirve como practicas pre profesionales y tambien para pagar sus estudios universitarios. Darwin en esta oportunidad está solicitando su préstamo para comprar material e instrumental odontológico. Darwin está muy agradecido con KIVA por permitirle mantenerse y desarrollarse en su actividad económica, la cual representa el principal ingreso económico para el pago de su educación.
texts.en: Darwin’s a member of the “Puntualito” communal bank in the city of Cusco, Peru.  He’s a young dentistry student who is very hardworking and enterprising.   He works in a dentist’s office, a job that allows him to do his pre-professional field work and also to pay for his university.  On this occasion, Darwin is asking for a loan to buy dental supplies and equipment.  He’s very grateful to KIVA for making it possible for him to support himself and develop in his economic activity which is his main source of income in order to pay for his education.

loans.use: to buy dental equipment and supplies.

loans.name: Benjamín Obed

texts.es:
Benjamín tiene 20 años de edad, es soltero. Vive junto a su mamá y a sus dos hermanos. Él es el hijo mayor, su otro hermano estudia y trabaja en la panadería de su tío y su hermanita de 11 años estudia y ayuda  su mamá en las labores del campo. Por el momento Benjamín, se encarga de repartir el pan y le ayuda a su padrastro con la panadería. 

Benjamín trabajo durante tres años en  una fábrica de quesos de la zona; pero la fabrica cerro y él empezó a trabajar con el tío a repartir el pan y también lo puede elaborar. El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para reparar su motocicleta, comprar un horno de seis latas, harina, manteca, levadura, cilindros para amasar; para iniciar la instalación de su panadería. Él espera que su panadería tenga buenos resultados, pues ya tiene clientes y de las ganancias que obtenga planea comprar una nueva motocicleta.
texts.en:
Benjamín, 20, is single living with his mother and two siblings.  He’s the oldest.  His other brother attends school and works in his uncle’s bakery and his 11-year-old sister goes to school and helps his mother work in the fields.  For the moment, Benjamín works delivering bread and helps his stepfather in the bakery.

Benjamín worked for three years in a local cheese factory but the factory shut down and he started to work for his uncle delivering bread; he also knows how to make it.  The loan he’s asking Fundación Campo for is to repair his motorcycle and to buy a six-can oven, flour, shortening, yeast and rolling pins to start setting up his bakery.  He hopes his bakery will have good results because he already has customers and he plans to use profits earned to buy a new motorcycle.

loans.use: to repair his motorcycle, to buy an oven and other bakery supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy clothes, underwear and footwear for adults and children.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy merchandise (new clothes) to expand her business.

loans.name: Luz Y Vida  (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
Los integrantes del banco comunal Luz y Vida realizan hace algunos años los créditos en la fundación, es un grupo de 6 socias y  1 socio que son vecinos y amigos del sector El Aguacate, a mas de estar en las reuniones han estrechado sus lasos de amistad, los créditos les permiten crecer en sus negocios para el bienestar de sus familias. Viven en la ciudad de Cuenca esta ciudad es reconocida por su belleza  arquitectónica, sus reservas naturales, la cultura y tradiciones de su gente.

Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora. Marcia, se encuentra realizando su primer crédito en el banco comunal Luz y Vida al que fue invitada por su mamá, vive por el sector del Aguacate en la ciudad de Cuenca.  Tiene 25 años de edad, vive en unión libre y ha concebido 3 hijos de 7 y 4 años que estudian en una escuelita de la ciudad, y su último hijo es un  bebé de 9 meses. Su esposo presta sus servicios como guardia de seguridad, la casa en la que vive es arrendada. 

La Señora. Marcia se dedica al comercio, labora a diario en un mercado de la ciudad vendiendo mariscos, en su casa se dedica a la cría y venta de patos, pollos y cuyes. Estas actividades le ayudan a mejorar los ingresos de su hogar. 

Su crédito va a invertir en la compra de mariscos.
 
Su meta es tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
The members of the Luz y Vida communal bank has been taking out loans with the foundation for several years. It is a group of 6 women and 1 man who are neighbors and friends in the El Aguacate sector. Aside from the meetings deepening their friendship, the loans have allowed them to grow their businesses for the wellbeing of their families. They lives in the city of Cuenca, a city known for its architectural beauty, its natural preserves, and its people's culture and traditions. 

One of the members of this group is Marcia. She is taking out her first loan in the Luz y Vida communal bank, She was invited by her mother and she lives in the Aguacate sector of the city of Cuenca. She is 25 years old and in a common law marriage. She has 3 children; a 7 and a 4 year old who got to school in the city, and a 9 month old baby. Her husband works as a security guard and the house she lives in is rented. 

Marcia is a merchant. She works every day at a city market, selling seafood. At home she raises and sells ducks, chickens and guinea pigs.These activities help her to improve her household income.

She is going to invest the loan in buying seafood. 
 
Her goal is own her own home.

loans.use: to buy seafood.

loans.name: Maria Corina

texts.es: La Sra. Maria  tiene 62 años y es soltera, ella se dedica a  servicio costura de polleras para las cholitas, en su taller propio que se encuentran en su mismo domicilio en la zona de Pampahasi , este préstamo es su segunda secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra. Maria  va a usar este préstamo  para la compra de material de construcción para el arreglo de la fachada de su casa,  ya que su deseo es tener su casita terminada, cuenta Maria que le va muy bien en su negocio de la confeccion de polleras pero la Sra. Maria enfrenta retos en su negocio que son la falta de maquinas  y a veces de material cuando le hacen pedidos por mayor depende de los trabajos que tiene que realizar,   La Sra. Maria es una persona trabajadora que su deseo es tener un taller grande y contratar mano de obra y así enseñar a jóvenes el oficio de la confección.
texts.en: María is 62 years old and single. She manages a sewing service of traditional skirts for "cholitas" (girls of indigenous descent) from her own shop located in her home in the area of Pampahasi. This loan is her second one from the institution. María is going to use this loan to buy construction material for the repair of the front of her house, since her dream is to finish her home. Maria's business of making traditional indigenous  Bolivian one-piece skirts is going well, but she faces challenges in her business, including a lack of machines and, sometimes, a lack of material when she receives wholesale order placements, depending on the tasks she has to perform. She is going to use the earnings to buy fabric. María is a hardworking person whose wish is to have a large shop, hire other workers and, in this way, teach young people the clothing trade.

loans.use: To buy construction material to finish the front of her house.

loans.name: Maluay  (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
Maluay es un banco comunal que está conformado por 13 socias quienes viven por la parroquia del Valle en Cuenca, esta parroquia se encuentra rodeada de vegetación y gracias a su geografía accidentada nos regalan hermosos paisajes, su gente se dedica a la agricultura, crianza de animales y al comercio y muchos laboran a diario en la ciudad. Las socias son mujeres que tienen diferentes actividades económicas las que le permiten solventar los gastos de sus hogares y salir  adelante a pesar de sus adversidades, ellas nunca pierden su alegría y cordialidad.

Una de las socias de este grupo es la señoea Delia, es una socia alegre, carismática, que forma parte del banco comunal Maluay hace 4 años, tiene una gran amistad con todas las socias ya que forman parte de una misma comunidad que se llama Maluay y pertenece a la parroquia del Valle.

La Señora Delia tiene 55 años de edad, vive en unión libre y ha concebido 5 hijos, dos de sus hijos están casados, dos de sus hijos trabajan y le ayudan económicamente y su último hijo estudia en un colegio de la ciudad. Su esposo es de profesión mecánico, la casa en la que viven es propia,  es una casita pequeña echa de adobe.

Doña Delia trabaja en el campo cultivando sus terrenos o cuando le llaman labora como jornalera, en su casa se dedica a la cría y venta de gallinas, cuyes y cerdos, la cosecha de sus cultivos es para el consumo de su hogar y también para la venta. 

Su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir compra de gallinas cuyes y abono para sus cultivos. 

Su meta es incrementar la crianza de cerdos.
texts.en:
Maluay Communal Bank is made up of 13 members who live in the parish of El Valle in Cuenca.  This parish is surrounded by vegetation, and the rugged geography offers beautiful scenery.  The people there make a living in agriculture, raising animals, and as merchants, and many of them work every day in the city.  The members are women who have various jobs that allow them to pay for the household expenses and get ahead.  In spite of their adversities, they never lose their happiness and friendliness.

Delia is one of the members of this group.  She's a happy and charismatic member who has been part of Maluay Communal Bank for four years.  She's great friends with all the members because they're part of the same community, Maluay, in the parish of El Valle.

Delia, 55, lives in a common-law relationship and has had five children.  Two of her children are married, two of them work and help her financially, and her last child studies in a school in the city.  Her husband is a mechanic by profession.  The house they live in is their own; it's a small house made of adobe.

Delia works in the field cultivating her land or working as a day laborer when she's needed.  At home she makes a living raising and selling chickens, guinea pigs, and pigs.  The crops she harvests are for household consumption and also to sell.

She's going to invest her new loan in buying chickens, guinea pigs, and fertilizer for her crops.

Her objective is to expand her pig breeding.

loans.use: to buy chickens, guinea pigs, and fertilizer

loans.name: Hoch

texts.en: Hoch is 27 years old. She is married and lives with her three children in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia. She has been selling all kinds of drinks for more than five years, earning approximately $5 daily. Her husband is a driver who makes an income of $4 each day. In order to develop her family’s economic viability, Hoch requests a loan of $1,000 to purchase a Tuk Tuk (transport vehicle) for her husband to run the taxi service at night. By doing so, he would generate extra income to support the family. In the future, Hoch would like to expand her business and send her children to a good school. Moreover, she hopes to build a new house a soon as possible

loans.use: to purchase a Tuk Tuk for her husband to run the taxi service at night.

loans.name: German

texts.en:
German is married and is a responsible father of two children. He is a conscientious and hardworking person. 

German has been involved in growing agricultural crops for over six years. He grows rice. When he started this business, he had two hectares of land and now he plans to expand his land. He wants to gather a good harvest and maximize his profit. 

German wants to obtain a loan in the sum of PHP 25,000 to purchase mineral fertilizers for his farm business.

loans.use: to expand and improve his business by purchasing fertilizer.

loans.name: Lun

texts.en:
Lun is 30 years old. She is married, has one child, and resides in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia. She is involved in breeding pigs. She makes an income of $3 daily. Her husband runs a public transportation service. He earns about $8 per day. 

Because the present motorbike is old, Lun is requesting a loan of $1000 to purchase a new motorbike, to replace the old one. This purchase will help her husband continue to earn more income for the family. In the future, she would like to expand her piggery and send her child to school. Moreover, she hopes to build a new house, as soon as possible.

loans.use: to purchase a new motorbike for her husband to use to provide taxi service, replacing the old motorbike.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is 55 years old and married with six adult children. Samuel's wife works as a full time housewife. Samuel is a farmer working in the Philippines.

Samuel has been growing rice for 10 years. He is asking for a loan to buy seeds and fertilizer for the farm. In the future, Samuel hopes that his farming business improves so that he can sustain the needs of his family.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Balbino

texts.en:
From the village of Carikkikan Norte, Balbino is 50 years old, married, and has two school-aged children. Balbino is a farmer whose main income derives from growing rice for sale. Engaged in this business for over 25 years, he earns approximately 10,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) during a harvest season.

Balbino's previous loan was used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise, and he is now requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP, to purchase fertilizers such as manure.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure.

loans.name: Vork

texts.en: Vork is 49 years old. He is a widower who lives with his son in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia. He has been involved in growing rice and fattening up animals for more than ten years, earning approximately $3 a day. His son is a construction worker who makes an income of $5 each day. In order to improve his family’s living conditions, Vork requests a loan of $500 to purchase timber and zinc to build a new house. This money will help him provide better living conditions for his family. In the future, he would like to expand his farming business and help his son earn a higher education.

loans.use: to purchase timber and zinc to build a new house

loans.name: Margilyn

texts.en:
Margilyn lives with her husband and three children. She is thankful because her husband is a supportive and hardworking man.

Margilyn operates one hectare of rice farmland, while her husband manages their welding shop. The couple aspires to have a stable source of income some day, so they can get ahead of life and educate their youngest child.

Aside from farming and the welding shop, Margilyn also raises two hogs as their additional source of income. 

By now, Margilyn is in need of additional capital to improve the growth of her crops. With regards to this situation, she is asking for a loan of PHP 30,000, which will be used to buy necessary fertilizer and insecticides. 

She knows that through sustaining of essential farm supplies to her farmland, she can also obtain higher yields and better income for her family’s needs.

loans.use: to buy necessary fertilizer and insecticides for her farming business.

loans.name: Christopher

texts.en:
Christopher, 40, lives with his family in the village of Carikrikan, where he conducts the family's farming activities. He grows crops such as rice on the family-owned 2-hectare plot of land.

Christopher is now requesting a loan of PHP 40,000 to purchase fertilizer for his farm. He plans to save some of his income to purchase furniture for the house, as the family currently has very little.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer such as manure for his farm.

loans.name: Jhoselyn Teresa

texts.es: Srta. Jhoselyn tiene 20 años, se dedica  a la actividad de venta de calzados y  tenis, por catalogo ella vende sus productos de manera ambulante, visitando domicilios y oficinas públicas y privadas de la ciudad de La Paz,  donde ofrece sus productos,  este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, la Srta. Jhoselyn va a utilizar este préstamo para la compra de calzados por mayor ya que tiene pedidos que entregar y de esta manera brindar variedad de productos a su clientela e incrementar su ganancia, esta actividad le permite mantenerse, se siente feliz y agradecida por la oportunidad que le brindan.
texts.en:
Ms. Jhoselyn is 20 years old and she sells shoes and sneakers.  She sells her products by catalog as a street vendor.  She visits homes and public and private offices in the city of La Paz where she offers her products.  

This loan is the first sequence in the institution.  Ms. Jhoselyn will use this loan to buy wholesale shoes since she has orders to deliver.  This way she can offer a variety of products to her customers and increase her profit.  This activity allows her to support herself.  She feels happy and grateful for the opportunity you give her.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise, sneakers.

loans.name: Ronald

texts.en:
Ronald is 48 years old and married. He has three grown up children. Ronald has been engaged in his farming business for ten years. Farming is his main source of income. He is a very loving father and husband. He will do everything to see to the needs of his family. 

Ronald is asking for a loan of 40,000 PHP to buy fertilizer for his farm. He hopes that his business will expand to fulfill the needs of his family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for his farm.

loans.name: Sok Kheng

texts.en: Sok Kheng is 45 years old. She is married and resides with her six children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She has been cultivating rice and fattening up animals for more than ten years, earning approximately $2 a day. Her husband (who is joining her in the picture) is a construction foreman who makes an income of $10 each day. Three of her children are employed; they earn about $9 per day. In order to improve her family’s finances, Sok Kheng requests a loan of $500 to purchase cattle to breed and resell when they gain weight. This purchase will help her make more income for the family. In the future, she would like to expand her business and help her children earn bachelor’s degrees. Moreover, she hopes to build a new house as soon as possible.

loans.use: to purchase cattle to breed and resell

loans.name: Brigido

texts.en:
Brigido is married with three children. Two of his children have finished their studies already, while the third is still studying. Brigido's wife is an Overseas Filipino Worker (OFW). Despite his situation as single parent, he is still able to manage his farm, motorcycle, hogs and family well.

Brigido owns a one-hectare rice field which he has run for 35 years. According to him, his family's main source of income comes from planting rice crops. Though he didn't finish his studies, he is determined to face every trial in his life.

Brigido would like to take out for a loan of 25,000 PHP which he will use to buy farm inputs such as fertilizer, herbicide and insecticide. He knows that through this loan, he can continue to improve his farming business. Brigido hopes that the lenders will continue to support him financially. In this way, he can obtain his goal in life, which is to let his youngest child finish his studies and have a comfortable lifestyle someday.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs such as fertilizer, herbicide and insecticide.

loans.name: San's Group

texts.en: San, 39 years old, resides in Battambang province’s Ek Phnom district in Cambodia. She is married and is a mother of six children, some of whom are school-aged and some of whom are employed as paid workers in Thailand. San offers a decent life for her family through raising pigs and cows. San’s husband complements the income by farming rice, planting bean, and catching fish. This hard-working couple can earn about 83,000KHR per day and they save approximately 14,000KHR after offsetting for their daily cost of living. San has been with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) for seven loan cycles already. The previous loans helped her relieve her family’s burdens. Now San is leading a loan group with three female members to take out a loan in the amount of 3,700,000KHR in total. As a group leader, she will utilize her loan portion in this loan, which is 1,400,000KHR, to support her business as well as her husband’s business by purchasing pig feed, fertilizer, pesticide, and bean seeds. Via the help of this loan, San believes that she will be able to generate more income to the family and use the income to keep her school-aged children in school.

loans.use: To purchase pig feed.

loans.name: Sosimo

texts.en:
Sosimo is 45 years old and is from the mountainous region of Isabela. As a father and a husband, he makes sure that he can satisfy all the needs of his family. To make a living, Sosimo is a farmer, an occupation he has had for almost ten years. He is asking for a loan of PHP 30,000 to buy fertilizer and seed for his farming business. 

Sosimo hopes that his children achieve their dreams.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seed for his farming business.

loans.name: Bonifacio

texts.en:
Bonifacio says "To serve your family with the whole heart, is the most precious give for them". He is 48 years old from Benito Soliven province of Isabela. 

Bonifacio has managed their farm for almost 5 years together with his wife Nolie. Farming is the only way for them to live, that's why he managed it well so that he can care for the needs of his family. He is requesting a loan in the amount of PHP 40,000 to buy seeds, fertilizer, and pesticide for his farming business. Bonifacio hopes that his business expands so that he can provide for the daily needs of his family.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer and pesticide for his farming business.

loans.name: Phang

texts.en: A resident of a rural village of the Ponhea Krek district, which is located in the Kampong Cham province in Cambodia, Phang is a 28-year-old married woman with three dependent daughters. To make a living, Phang and her husband farm rice, plant cassava, raise pigs, and sell grocery items. Phang is requesting a USD 1,100 loan with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) for the first time. With this first requested loan, she will operate a new business, which is buying fertilizer to sell. This industrious woman, Phang, expects a boost in her income after receiving her loan and wisely using it. In the future, she dreams of being able to buy more plots of land to plant rubber, which is one more new business for her.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer to sell

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Ric

texts.en:
Ric is 36 years of age and married to an Overseas Filipino Worker (OFW). The couple were blessed with two children, one who is an elementary pupil and the youngest is still an infant. Ric and his wife both aim to have comfortable living conditions and stable source of income.

Ric owns a rice field where he has run this kind of business for ten years. Since his wife left him because of better opportunities, he then both stands as father and mother to his two children. He is really grateful because he can manage both his family and his farming business.

Ric plans to buy necessary farm supplies such as fertilizer and insecticides and to pay for labor cost for spraying and cleaning his rice field to become more productive. But his capital intended in purchasing all this materials is not enough, so he is requesting a loan of 30,000 PHP. He hopes to obtain this amount of loan so he could give his family a better way of living and maintain his rice farming business.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies such as fertilizer and insecticides, and to pay for labor cost for spraying and cleaning his rice field

loans.name: Robinson

texts.en: Robinson, 50 years old, is married to Rosadilla and has ten children. He lives in the forest region of Isabela. He is asking for a loan amounting PHP 40,000 to buy fertilizer, seeds, and use the excess money to hire a labourer for his farm. Being a father of ten children, he needs to double his efforts in work so that he can provide for their needs, most especially for the children's studies. Robinson's only dreams are that he can see all his children finish their studies and have better futures.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seeds, and pay for the costs of hiring a labourer

loans.name: Nary

texts.en:
A citizen living in a rural area of Kandal Stoeng district in the Kandal province of Cambodia, Nary is a 52-year-old widow with six children, one of whom (a son) is still under her responsibility and is currently in school. To make a living, this single mother (Nary) farms rice and plants vegetables, the businesses in which she has been involved with for more than ten years, earning around 5USD per day and managing to save approximately 3USD after canceling out her daily expenses. 

This will be Nary’s fourth time requesting a loan via VisionFund, Kiva’s partner. The previous loans have offered her with a sufficient working capital to support her current businesses, which provided the main source of the family’s income. This time, she is applying for a 600USD loan to buy a decent motorbike to support her vegetable-selling business. After receiving and utilizing the loan as she plans, Nary believes that she will be able to satisfy her customers more by delivering the vegetables quickly and on time.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike to support her vegetable-selling business

loans.name: Jobert

texts.en:
Joebert is 35 years old. He is a farmer from the forest region of Isabela. He has managed a farm to sustain the needs of his family. 

Joebert is asking for a loan in the amount of PHP 20,000 to provide for the needs of his farm. Being a father and husband, he hopes to do everything for his family.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer and pesticide for his farm.

loans.name: Ngit

texts.en:
Ngit is 41 years old. She is married and resides with six children in Prey Veng Province, Cambodia.

She has been cultivating rice and fattening up animals for more than 10 years, earning approximately $6 a day. Her husband, a construction worker, makes an income of $3 per day. Three of Ngit’s children are employed in a garment factory. They earn about $15 each day. 

Due to a lack of funds, Ngit is requesting a loan of $1,000 to purchase fertilizer, fuel and pesticide for farming. This purchase will help her crops grow well and provide high yields. 

In the future, Ngit would like to expand her farming business and help her children earn a higher education. Moreover, she hopes to build a new house as soon as possible.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, fuel and pesticide for farming

loans.name: Eliza

texts.en:
Eliza peacefully lives at Solana with her spouse and three children. Her spouse is a farmer and they plant and harvest rice to sell. They also pay laborers who help them plant and harvest the rice. 

From the farming business, they usually gain 15,000 PHP each harvest season (twice per year). Aside from farming, Eliza also manages a small store as an additional source of income.   

Eliza is now borrowing a loan of 20,000 PHP to buy insecticide and pay for the labor cost of farming. This will help ensure good crop nutrition and an abundant harvest. 

In the future, Eliza would like to keep improving the farming income for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy insecticide and pay for the labor cost of rice farming.

loans.name: Arceli

texts.en:
Arceli is 30 years old and married to a farmer. Together they work hard in the farming business. They plant and harvest rice to sell to traders. From their business, they earn approximately P15,000 per harvest season. It goes towards the family's consumption of meals and paying for the school fees of her child. 

Now, Arceli is asking for a loan of P20,000 to buy fertilizers and insecticides used in farming. This will help ensure the healthy growth of crops. Arceli hopes to achieve a bountiful harvest and keep developing her business for the overall welfare of her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and insecticides used in farming

loans.name: Loek's Group

texts.en: Loek is 42 years old and a villager living in a rural village of Battambang province’s Ek Phnom district, Cambodia. She is married and a mother of three dependent children, all of whom are school-aged children. Loek offers a decent life for her family by raising pigs while her husband complements the income by working as a rice farmer and a fisherman. Together, they are able to earn around 75,000KHR per day and manage to save approximately 14,000KHR after offsetting the daily cost of living. This will be Loek’s seventh time requesting loan via Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. The previous loans have enabled her to better support her family and improve the family’s living condition as well. Now, Loek is leading a loan group of five female members, who all have been with VisionFund before and successfully paid back their previous loans, to take out a loan in the amount of 6,800,000KHR in total. As a group representative, Loek will spend her loan portion (1,400,000KHR) to support her pig-raising business by purchasing pig feed and to support her husband’s rice-growing business by purchasing fertilizer and pesticide. After receiving the loan portion and effectively using it, Loek highly believes that she and her husband can smoothly run the business, generating more income for the family. This industrious woman (Loek) would love to use the income to move her family ahead and, most importantly, keep her beloved children in school.

loans.use: to purchase pig feed.

loans.name: Adin

texts.en:
Adin is a hard-working man. He lives with his wife and their five children. They live in the house he inherited within the community. All his life, he has made a living in farming and with livestock. He has his own farmland that he inherited from his parents. He grows corn there with his wife. He looks in on his plants every month to see that they are growing well, and occasionally, he also sells animals.

There had been difficult times for his family and there were many occasions when the climate conditions were not favorable. However, he has not given up and has looked for better strategies in order to continue moving forward. One of these strategies is to work in a dependent way while his wife checks in on the plantations. When the ripening season arrives, he gets together with his family in order to harvest the crops and to sell everything in the local market.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seeds for farming

loans.name: Khoeurn

texts.en:
Khoeurn is 48 years old. He is married and resides with six children in Kandal Province, Cambodia. He has been involved in the agricultural business for more than 10 years, earning approximately $9 daily. His wife helps him run the business. Two of the children are construction workers. They earn about $6 each day.  

In order to improve his family’s finances, Khoeurn is requesting a loan of $1000 to purchase farmland to use for farming. This purchase helps him expand his business and make more income for the family. In the future, he would like to run an additional business purchasing vegetables to resell and help his children earn bachelor’s degrees. Moreover, he hopes to build a new house.

loans.use: to purchase farmland to use for farming.

loans.name: Reum

texts.en:
Reum is 39 years old. She is married and resides with three children in Kampong Speu Province, Cambodia. She has been cultivating rice and fattening up animals for more than ten years, earning approximately $4 daily. Her husband is a construction foreman who makes an income of $9 each day. One of her children is a garment worker and earns about $5 per day. 

In order to improve her family’s finances, Reum requests a loan of $1100 to purchase piglets and fodder to use for breeding. By doing so, she would earn more income to financially support the family. In the future, she would like to expand her business and help her children earn higher education. Moreover, she hopes to build a new house as soon as possible.

loans.use: to purchase piglets and fodder to use for breeding

loans.name: Gilbert

texts.en:
Gilbert, a local farmer from the forest region of Isabela, is 28 years old and married. He grows corn, and his wife sells vegetables, in order to support their children. He has been involved in this business for 20 years.

He is applying for a loan. He used his previous loan to expand his business gradually and to support his family. He has completely repaid his first loan already. His new loan request is for PHP 20,000. He will use the loan to buy fertilizer for his farmland. He expects to receive a high yield so he can earn more income in order to maintain his children's education.

loans.use: buy a fertilizer for his farmland.

loans.name: Elisa

texts.pt:
Solteira e mãe de 3 filhos, todos frequentam a Escola, vive na casa da sua mãe e não sustenta mais ninguém para além de seus filhos.
É cabeleireira e possui um salão próprio e com o presente empréstimo pretende comprar produtos de cabelo, de beleza e extensões de cabelo para aumentar a quantidade de seu produto. 
No futuro deseja melhorar ainda mais o seu estabelecimento de forma a atrair mais a sua clientela, para tal compromete-se a pagar devidamente o empréstimo para solicitar mais a Hluvuku. 
De momento não tem nenhum desafio para além de manter-se sempre saudável.
texts.en:
Elisa is single and the mother of 3 children, all of whom attend School. She lives in her mother's house and doesn't support anyone else other than her children.

She's a hairdresser and has her own salon. With this loan she plans to buy hair products, beauty products and hair extensions to increase the quantity of her stock.

In future Elisa wishes to improve her establishment even more so as to attract more clients. To this end she commits to duly paying off the loan in order to solicit further loans from Hluvuku.

At this moment she doesn't have any challenges other than staying healthy.

loans.use: buy hair products, beauty products and hair extensions

loans.name: Romelo

texts.en:
Romelo has been engaged in the farming business, particularly raising rice crops. He is 46 years old and happily married. He and his wife were blessed with four children. Two of them are working, one is married, and the youngest is still studying. Romelo's wife is a vendor of native cakes and fruits, in their local community. He is glad, because his wife is supportive and responsible, too. 

Romelo's earned profit goes to their family's daily needs, maintenance for his motorcycle transport, and monthly electric bills. So the capital intended for his farm land is no longer enough. With regard to this matter, he is seeking another loan amount of PHP 20,000, which will allow him to buy necessary farm supplies, such as fertilizer and insecticide. He believes that applying these farm supplies to his rice crops will ensure proper growth, which will enable him to earn greater profit for his family's welfare.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies, such as fertilizer and insecticide, for cultivating rice.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy products (oil, beer, potatoes, meat, peanuts and others) to increase the quantity of his stock and resell them.

loans.name: Emilia

texts.pt:
Casada e mãe de 3 filhos, todos frequentam a Escola, vive na casa própria com a sua família e sustenta os pais mandando alguma ajuda de vez enquanto.
É docente e quadro do Ministério da Educação. Com o presente empréstimo pretende comprar material de construção (pedra, cimento, areia, ferro, janelas e outros) para dar continuidade com a ampliação da sua casa. 
No futuro deseja construir um estabelecimento no mercado local, para tal compromete-se a pagar devidamente o empréstimo para solicitar mais a Hluvuku. 
O desafio é continuar com os seus estudos atem atingir o nível superior.
texts.en:
Emilia is married and the mother of 3 children, all of whom attend School, lives in her own house with her family and supports her parents by sending them some money every once in a while.

She's a teacher and a permanent employee of the Ministry of Education. With this loan she plans to buy construction material (stone, cement, sand, iron, windows and others) to continue the extension of her house.

In future, Emilia wishes to build an establishment in her local market. To this end she commits to duly paying off the loan in order to solicit further loans from Hluvuku.

Her challenge is to continue her studies until she completes higher education.

loans.use: buy construction material (stone, cement, sand, iron, windows and others) to continue the extension of her house.

loans.name: Carlitos

texts.pt:
Casado e pai de 8 filhos, dos quais 3 frequentam a Escola, vive na casa própria com a sua família e não sustenta mais ninguém.
É negociante e criador de gado e dono de negócio de venda de produtos alimentares. Com o presente empréstimo pretende comprar produtos (arroz, amendoim, óleo, feijão, e outros) para aumentar a quantidade da sua mercadoria. 
No futuro deseja fazer crescer o seu negócio para melhor satisfazer os seus clientes, para tal compromete-se a pagar devidamente o empréstimo para solicitar mais a Hluvuku. 
O desafio é reunir esforços para garantir a formação superior dos seus filhos.
texts.en:
Carlitos is married and the father of 8 children, 3 of whom attend School. He lives in his own house with his family and doesn't support anyone else.

He's a trader, rears cattle and owns a business selling food products. With this loan he plans to buy products (rice, peanuts, oil, beans and others) to increase the quantity of his stock.

In future he hopes to grow his business to better satisfy his customers. To this end, he commits to duly paying off the loan in order to solicit further loans from Hluvuku.

His challenge is to focus his efforts to guarantee his children's education.

loans.use: buy products (rice, peanuts, oil, beans and others) to increase the quantity of his stock.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy products (rice, peanuts, oil, beans and others) to increase the quantity of her stock.

loans.name: Armando

texts.pt:
Casado e pai de 6 filhos, dos quais 3 frequentam a Escola, vive na casa própria com sua família e não sustenta mais ninguém.
É negociante e dono do próprio negócio de venda de produtos alimentares. Com o presente empréstimo pretende comprar produtos (óleo, feijão, refrescos, cervejas, e outros) para aumentar e diversificar a sua mercadoria. 
No futuro deseja aumentar o nível do seu negócio e melhorar as condições de vida da sua família, para tal compromete-se a pagar devidamente o empréstimo para solicitar mais a Hluvuku. 
O desafio é a grande concorrência no mercado, e adquirir fundos suficientes para realizar os seus projectos.
texts.en:
Armando is married and the father of 6 children, 3 of whom attend School. He lives in his own house with his family and doesn't support anyone else.

He's a trader and owns his own business selling food products. With the current loan he plans to buy products (oil, beans, sodas, beers and others) to diversify and increase the quantity his stock.

In future Armando hopes to expand his business and improve his family's living conditions. To this end, he commits to duly paying off the loan in order to solicit further loans from Hluvuku.

His challenge is the large amount of competition in the market and obtaining enough funds to carry out his projects.

loans.use: buy products (oil, beans, sodas, beers and others) to diversify and increase the quantity his stock.

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia is 43 years old, married and has five children. Her spouse is a farmer and her partner in planting and harvesting rice to sell to traders. They also pay additional laborers who help them in the farming business. She usually gains about PHP 15,000 each harvest season, twice a year. 

Delia wants to improve her crop production. This is why she is now asking for a loan of PHP 20,000 to invest in buying farming inputs which will help ensure good nutrition to crops. She will buy fertilizers and pesticides. 

In the future, Delia hopes to keep achieving abundant harvests so she can build a reserve fund for her family's unexpected expenses and especially for their education.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides used in farming

loans.name: Samart's Group

texts.en:
Samart, 62 years old, lives in a rural area in the Sa Ang district, Kandal province. She is married and has one child. Samart and her husband have made a living by farming rice and planting cabbage for 33 years. The current business earns her about KHR 7,000 per day to support the family.

This is the third loan for Samart with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. She fully repaid the past loans. She and her group member are applying for a loan. Samart, the leader, is going to use her portion to buy materials, such as a latrine bowl, tile and sewage draining, etc., to build a proper latrine. She hopes this loan will enable her family to have a healthy latrine for an improved life.

loans.use: to buy materials to build a proper latrine.

loans.name: Elias

texts.pt:
Casado e pai de 1 filho que já frequenta a Escola, vive na casa cedida pelos serviços e não sustenta mais ninguém para além da sua família.
É trabalhador da empresa caminhos-de-ferro de Moçambique (CFM) é assentador de via. Com o presente empréstimo pretende comprar material de construção (cimento, chapas de zinco, pranchas, ferro, pedra e outros) para dar continuidade com o melhoramento da sua casa. 
No futuro deseja concluir e mobilar a sua casa e sair da casa dos serviços e passar a residir em sua própria casa, para tal compromete-se a pagar devidamente o empréstimo para solicitar mais a Hluvuku. 
O desafio é conseguir fundos para investimento.
texts.en:
Elias is married and the father of 1 son who already attends School, lives in a house lent to him by the government and doesn't support anyone else other than his family.

He works for Mozambique's national railway company, laying the tracks. With this loan he plans to buy construction materials (cement, zinc plates, iron, stone and others) to continue the improvements he's making on his home.

In future, Elias hopes to finish and furnish his house, leave the house lent to him currently and live in his own house. To this end he commits to duly paying off the loan in order to solicit further loans from Hluvuku.

His challenge is to obtain funds for investment.

loans.use: buy construction material (cement, zinc plates, iron, stone and others) to continue the improvements he's making on his home.

loans.name: Minh

texts.en:
Minh was born in 1976. She has two children who are learning at the 9th grade and 6th grade. Her husband grows rice to earn a living. 

Minh raises chickens and gets 3,000,000 VND a month. Her family’s total earnings are about 5,000,000 VND per month.

She has participated in SEDA's credit program since 2007. In the last cycle she borrowed 9,632,000 VND and repaid the loan on time. In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow 10,528,000 VND to buy food for chickens. She always wants to earn more money for her family’s income and can help her children have good careers.

loans.use: to buy food for chickens.

loans.name: Noly

texts.en:
Noly, 43 years old, is from the forest region of Isabela. He is married with five children. Noly manages a farm together with his wife, Margie. 

To sustain the needs of his family, Noly is asking for a loan of 40,000 PHP to buy fertilizer and seeds for his farm. Farming is the only way they live. Noly hopes that someday he can put up a store in front of their house, so that they have a source of additional income.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seed for his farm.

loans.name: Mai

texts.en:
Mai was born in 1970. She has two children. Her older child is a soldier, and her younger child is in high school. Her husband sells dishes in the market and earns 3,000,000 VND per month. For the past 10 years, Mai has run a grocery store to earn a living, earning about 3,000,000 VND per month. Therefore, her family’s total earnings are about 6,000,000 VND per month. 
	
Mai has participated in SEDA's credit program since 2007. In the last cycle, she borrowed 9,632,000 VND and repaid the loan on time. In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow 10,080,000 VND to buy noodles, rice, snacks, and sodas to sell in her grocery store. She always wants to enlarge her store and will use the anticipated profits to pay her child’s educational fees.

loans.use: to buy noodles, rice, snacks, and sodas to sell in her grocery store.

loans.name: Leopoldo

texts.en: Leopoldo, 39 years old, is married to Charibel and is from the village of the Benito Soliven Province of Isabela. He is engaged in farming to provide for the needs of his family. Leopoldo is asking for a loan of Php 30,000 to to purchase two sacks of seed and fertilizer for his farm. He hopes that someday he can renovate their house for a better living condition.

loans.use: to purchase two sacks of seed and fertilizer for his farm.

loans.name: Hermelinda

texts.pt:
Casada e mãe de 5 filhos, alguns já maiores de idade, vive na casa própria com a sua família e sustenta 2 netos que vivem com ela.
É comerciante vende frangos de corte e com o presente empréstimo pretende comprar pintos, ração e vitaminas para aumentar a quantidade da sua criação e responder a demanda da sua clientela. 
No futuro deseja aumentar a produtividade adquirir mais experiencia no ramo de criação e melhorar as condições de vida da sua família, para tal compromete-se a pagar devidamente o empréstimo para solicitar mais a Hluvuku. 
O desafio é a concorrência no mercado e controlar as doenças.
texts.en:
Hermelinda is married and the mother of 5 children, some of whom are already of age. She lives in her own house with her family and supports 2 grandchildren who live with her.

She's a trader and sells hens for slaughter. With this loan she plans to buy chicks, ration and vitamins to help increase her production and respond to her customers' demand.

In future, Hermelinda wishes to increase her production, obtain more experience in raising hens and improve her family's living conditions. To this end she commits to duly paying off the loan in order to solicit further loans from Hluvuku.

Her challenge is the competition in the market and controlling diseases.

loans.use: buy chicks, ration and vitamins to help increase her production and respond to her customers' demand.

loans.name: Fernando

texts.pt:
Casado e pai de 2 filhos que frequentam a Escola, vive na casa própria com a sua família e sustenta 2 irmãos que vivem com ele.
É alfaiate, faz corte e costura de vestuário diverso e com o presente empréstimo pretende comprar tecidos e outros acessórios diversos para a costura de vestuário e vender. 
No futuro deseja melhorar os seus serviços e criar uma sustentabilidade na sua actividade e melhorar as condições de sua residência, para tal compromete-se a pagar devidamente o empréstimo para solicitar mais a Hluvuku. 
O desafio é conseguir atrair mais clientes para afluir ao seu negócio com frequência.
texts.en:
Fernando is married and the father of 2 children who go to School, lives in his own house with his family and supports 2 brothers who live with him.

He's a tailor, tailoring various types of clothing and with this loan he plans to buy fabric and other accessories for sewing and selling clothing.

In future he hopes to improve his services and create some sustainability in his activity and improve the living conditions in his home. To this end he commits to duly paying off the loan in order to solicit further loans from Hluvuku.

His challenge is to attract more clients who become regulars.

loans.use: buy fabric and other accessories for sewing and selling clothing.

loans.name: Nafitália

texts.pt:
Solteira e mãe de 1 filho que já frequenta a Escola, vive na casa dos pais e ajuda os seus pais que vivem com ela nas despesas de casa.
É comerciante e vende diversos produtos que adquire na Republica da África do sul. Com o presente empréstimo pretende comprar produtos (amendoim, óleo, bebidas alcoólicas, carne, sabão e outros) para aumentar a quantidade da sua mercadoria. 
No futuro deseja abrir mais um estabelecimento comercial para aumentar o seu rendimento, para tal compromete-se a pagar devidamente o empréstimo para solicitar mais a Hluvuku. 
O desafio é voltar a Escola e elevar o seu nível académico.
texts.en:
Nafitália is single and the mother of 1 son who already goes to School. She lives in her parents' house and helps her parents with household expenses.

She's a trader and sells various products that she buys in the Republic of South Africa. With this loan she plans to buy products (peanuts, oil, alcoholic beverages, meat, soap and others) to increase the quantity of her stock.

In future she hopes to open a commercial establishment to increase her income. To this end, she commits to duly paying off the loan in order to solicit further loans from Hluvuku.

Her challenge is to go back to School and increase her level of education.

loans.use: buy products (peanuts, oil, alcoholic beverages, meat, soap and others) to increase the quantity of her stock.

loans.name: Mely

texts.en:
Mely is 62 years old and is married to Ignacio. At her age, Mely still works in livestock, raising pigs to earn income. From this business, she is able to earn about PHP 8,000 per head after fattening them. She is grateful that her income allows her to help sustain the daily needs of her family. She dreams of lifting her family from poverty, which is why she works hard at her hog raising business. 

Mely also wants to provide the necessities for her pigs. So, she is requesting a loan of PHP 45,000 to buy feed, vaccine, and vitamins for her pigs. She hopes this will make them fit and nourished to earn higher profits at selling time. Mely also hopes to grow her business to secure her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy feed, vaccine, and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Xuyen

texts.en:
Xuyen was born in 1983. She has three children. Her two older children are learning at primary school. Her younger child has just been born. Her husband is a building worker. She collects iron scrap to earn a living. Her income is about 3,000,000 VND. Her family’s total earnings are about 7,000,000 VND per month. 

She has participated in SEDA's credit program since 2008. In the last cycle she borrowed 9,632,000 VND and repaid the loan on time. In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow 10,080,000 VND to collect more iron scrap to recycle. She always wants to raise her children up well.

loans.use: to collect more iron scrap to recycle.

loans.name: Hai

texts.en:
Hai was born in 1962. She has two children. They are learning at secondary school and at the university. Her husband grows rice. 

To earn a living, Hai raises chickens. She gets 2,500,000 VND per month. Her family’s total earnings are about 4,500,000 VND per month. 

Hao has participated in the Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance (SEDA) credit program since 2007. In the last cycle, she borrowed 9,632,000 VND and repaid the loan on time. 

In this loan cycle, Hao would like to borrow 9,632,000 VND to buy chicken feed. She always wants to raise her children well, so they can get a job in the future.

loans.use: to buy chicken feed.

loans.name: Sérgio

texts.pt:
Casado e pai de 2 filhos, todos frequentam a Escola, vive na casa própria com sua família e sustenta os seus pais enviando dinheiro sempre que possível para despesas alimentares.
É técnico agro-pecuário. Com o presente empréstimo pretende comprar material de construção (cimento, chapas, barrotes, tijoleira, e outros) para dar continuidade a obra da sua casa. 
No futuro deseja concluir e mobilar a casa e crescer profissionalmente, para tal compromete-se a pagar devidamente o empréstimo para solicitar mais a Hluvuku. 
O desafio é o elevado custo de vida.
texts.en:
Sergio is married and the father of 2 children who both attend School, lives in his own house with his family and supports his parents by sending them money to help with food expenses whenever possible.

He works for a company producing crops and rearing animals. With this loan he plans to buy construction materials (cement, metal plates, beams, bricks and others) to continue the building work on his house.

In future he wishes to finish and furnish his home and grow professionally. To this end he commits to duly paying off the loan in order to solicit further loans from Hluvuku.

His challenge is the high cost of living.
