He has now spent five years doing his own farming, as he obtains good profits cultivating these crops. He is requesting a loan of PHP 30,000 so that he can cultivate and harvest the crops and improve the family's income.

He dreams of expanding his crops, improving his profits, finishing the construction of a house that he has for his family, and giving them better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer for his farm.

loans.name: Mildred

texts.en:
Mildred is from the village of Lallo. She is a 37-year-old who works hard to provide for her three children's needs. She owns and operates a general store. The main source of her income is from her business so she wants to maintain a good flow of it. She has been engaged in the business for over 10 years and earns approximately PHP 500 a day from it. She aspires for more. 

Now, she is requesting a loan of PHP 28,000 which will be used to purchase beverages, soap, candies, spices, noodles, sugar and canned goods. She hopes that she can earn a higher income as she increases her capital. She aims to use the additional income generated from the business to improve their living situation and save for the education of her children.

loans.use: to purchase beverages, soap, candies, spices, noodles, sugar and canned goods.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is 49 years-of age, married and blessed with two children. Her husband operates a farming business as a source of income. Their children are studying in college. To supplement the income of her husband, Erlinda engages in fruit and vegetable vending.

Erlinda wants to create prosperity in her business in order to support the basic necessities of her family. For this reason she is requesting a loan of PHP 25,000 to buy more bananas and vegetables to sell in the public market. She hopes that with the loan, she will achieve her desired profits to save for her children’s future.

loans.use: to buy more bananas and vegetables

loans.name: Ma.leonora Theresa

texts.en:
Ma.leonora Theresa is a mother who runs a small variety store in her community to generate income. She aimed to improve the business to help her husband in financing the education of their three children. They want to educate their children, so that they will earn a degree and find a good job someday. 

Ma.leonora Theresa aimed to increase her product offerings to satisfy her customers' demand. Due to insufficient capital, she is requesting additional capital of 7,000 PHP to buy soft drinks, noodles, biscuits, seasonings, canned goods, eggs, and charcoal for resale. Through this financial assistance, Ma.leonora Theresa is expecting that she will make an improvement in the business and she is hoping that she will be successful in the future.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, noodles, biscuits, seasonings, canned goods, eggs, and charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Rosemelita

texts.en: Rosemelita is 54 years old. She is married and has three children. She lives with her family in Naguilan and she operates a sari-sari store business as a source of income. She has been doing this for four years. Rosemelita only receives P1,000 every month, which is not enough to pay for her family's expenses. Right now, she is requesting a loan of P25,000 to purchase detergent soap, toothpaste, shampoo, canned goods, sweets, and candies for her business. She hopes that she can get the amount she requested in order to achieve higher proceeds to cover all of the family's expenses.

loans.use: to purchase detergent soap, toothpaste, shampoo, canned goods, sweets, and candies for her sari-sari store

loans.name: Lucas

texts.en:
Lucas is a farmer of 41 years of age. He has a simple relationship with his wife and he lives in Benito. He has five children. He works growing corn. He learned this from his father when Lucas was little because he helped out in the fields and it was his first job.

Lucas is asking for a loan of PHP 30,000 so he can buy seeds and fertilizer for cultivating and harvesting corn to improve the family's income. His dreams are to expand his cultivation to other farmlands and to provide his children with educations to improve the conditions of life for all his family.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer for cultivating and harvesting corn

loans.name: Rubyline

texts.en: Rubyline is 41 years old, married, and has four children. She lives with her family in a village and generates her income through her sari-sari store and food-vending business. She aims to earn more income to provide for her family's needs and save for the futures of her children, but even though Rubyline tried to increase her proceeds, she hasn’t been able to gain much due to poor product offerings. Therefore, she is requesting a loan of 25,000 PHP, which she will use to buy vegetables and meat to cook, as well as canned goods, noodles, canton, drinks, breads, and biscuits to sell in her store. In this matter, she will continuously generate a higher income from her businesses.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, meat, canned goods, noodles, canton, drinks, breads, and biscuits

loans.name: Ilam

texts.en: Ilam, 51, has followed his parents’ example of being a hardworking, responsible, and honest person. This is his second loan request and he’s been punctual with his payments. Ilam is grateful to Feliza for the support it’s given him and at the same time he commits to continue being responsible with his loan. He requests the loan to buy chemical fertilizer, organic fertilizer, and seeds for his farm.

loans.use: to buy chemical fertilizer, organic fertilizer, and seeds for his farm.

loans.name: Khorn's Group

texts.en:
Residing in the rural village of Kror Kor district in Cambodia’s Pursat province, Khorn is 53 years of age and married. To offer a decent life for his family, Khorn raises four heads of pigs and farms rice on a one-and-a-half-hectare plot of farmland. He has been involved in the businesses for more than ten years. Khorn’s wife also assists in the rice-growing business. Together, they are able to generate an income around 15,000KHR daily. 

Khorn has been with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) for four loan cycles already, with which he succeeded in meeting food needs for his family. To support the current businesses, Khorn is leading a loan group of four members to take out a loan in the amount of 5,400,000KHR in total. With the requested loan portion, which is 1,400,000KHR, Khorn plans on buying pig feed and fertilizer. He believes that he will be able to smoothly run his businesses, leading to more income for his family.

loans.use: to buy pig feed and fertilizer

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en: Having the fortitude to overcome poverty, Lydia plans to expand her piggery business, as well as sari-sari store, to increase her income. She has been operating these businesses for over 21 years and usually earns a profit of PHP 10,000 monthly. She usually spends her income on food, clothing, electric bills, and necessities for her children. To make certain of receiving high proceeds, Lydia is asking for a loan of PHP 50,000 to buy feed, medicine, vitamins, and groceries, such as beverages, coffee, milk, detergent soap, fabric conditioner, shampoo, and canned goods for her businesses. She believes the loan will help her improve and provide her with fruitful proceeds.

loans.use: to buy feed, medicine, vitamins, and groceries for her businesses

loans.name: Gerlie

texts.en: Gerlie is 30, married, and has two children. She engages herself in a hog-fattening business. She has been in her business for almost four years and usually earns a profit of 6,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month that she uses to obtain her family's basic necessities. She wants to earn more than her usual income, which causes her to request a loan of 25,000 PHP to buy feed, vitamins, and vaccines for the hogs. She believes that through hard work, she will improve the business and hopes that she will earn a higher income.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins, and vaccines for her hog business

loans.name: Hang

texts.en:
Hang was born in 1985. She has three children. Her two older children are learning at a primary school. Her youngest child has just been born. Hang and her husband sell plastic bags to earn a living. Her income is about 3,500,000 VND. Her family’s total earnings are about 7,000,000 VND per month. 

Hang has participated in SEDA's credit program since 2009. In the last cycle she borrowed 9,632,000 VND and repaid the loan on time. In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow 10,080,000 VND to buy more ingredients to make plastic bags and plastic tools. She wants to raise her children up well.

loans.use: to buy more ingredients to make plastic bags and plastic tools

loans.name: Julita

texts.en:
Julita and her family stay at Solana and have a farming business as the family's main source of income. They plant and harvest rice to sell to traders in their village. They usually generate about P15,000 each harvest season, which is twice a year. The money is used to pay for their meals, pay off bills at home, and pay for the education expenses of her four children. 

Julita is now asking for a loan of P20,000 to invest in the farming business to ensure good nutrition. She will buy fertilizers and pesticides used in farming. 

In the future, Julita would like to keep achieving abundant crops so they will earn more income for the development of the family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides used in farming

loans.name: Racquel

texts.en:
Racquel is 46 years old, married and blessed with five children. Her husband is a farmer and her partner in making their living better. With her strong will to achieve her vision, which is giving better livelihood, Raquel continues her journey in life by operating a piggery business. She has been in this business for over two years. She just loves her work because it really helps their poor economic status to lift up. She wishes for continued growth of her business, to gain higher income, and build up for a further business as a source of income.

She is requesting a loan of PHP 25,000 to buy feeds, vitamins, vaccine and medicine. She hopes to manage her business well and to be able to attain her dream.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins, vaccine and medicine.

loans.name: Roldan

texts.en: Roldan is an industrious person, who is engaged in growing rice as a source of income. He is 21 years old and still single. He helps his parent in lifting up their poor standard of living. He works hard in his business to yield good proceeds. Right now, Roldan is asking for a loan of PHP 25,000 to buy seed, fertilizers and insecticides to sustain his farm production levels. He hopes to maintain his business to secure a best way of living.

loans.use: to buy seed, fertilizers and insecticides.

loans.name: Audon

texts.en: Audon is 51 years old and married with four grown-up children. Audon lived in the forest region of Isabela. He engaged in farming business for 15 years. He is very diligent person. Audon provides all the needs of his family, thats why he does everything for them. He is asking a loan amounting to PHP 30,000 to buy seed and fertilizer for his farm.

loans.use: to buy seed and fertilizer for his farm.

loans.name: Adonis

texts.en: Adonis is 48 years old from the forest region of Isabela. Adonis has managed a farm together with his wife, Leilani, for ten years. He is asking for a loan of PHP 30,000 to buy fertilizer, pesticides, and seeds for his farm. Adonis hopes that his business expands so that he can sustain the needs of his family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, pesticides, and seeds for his farm

loans.name: Pey's Group

texts.en:
Pey, 34, is married and living with her family in a village of the Moung Russey district of Battambang province, Cambodia. She has three children, all of whom are dependent on her and still in school. For the last eight years, Pey and her husband have been farming rice on a four-hectare farmland as the main source of the family’s income to make a living. Together, they can earn about 26,000 KHR per day from the current business to meet the family’s need.

Pey’s group consists of two members and she is in the first cycle with VisionFund. They are now requesting a loan with VisionFund of 1,000,000KHR each. Pey, who is the leader, will use her portion to buy fertilizer, rice seeds and pesticides for her farmland. She hopes to get a high yield from her farming business so as to sell for a good price.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, rice seeds and pesticides for her farmland.

loans.name: Maly's Group

texts.en:
A citizen from a rural village of Battambang province’s Moung Russey district, Maly is age 47 years and married. She has five children to take care of and one of them is dependent and still in school. To feed her family, Maly has worked hard as a rice farmer on two hectares of farmland for ten years. 

Sometimes her husband works for others for a fee to better feed their children. The current business earns them about 28,000KHR per day and they manage to save about 12,000KHR each day after daily expenses.

Maly’s group consists of two members who are all female and she has been with VisionFund for four cycles, while the other member has been with VisionFund for three cycles. Maly fully repaid the loans which have helped her gradually improve her living and support her child’s education. 

Now she is leading her group to apply for a loan with VisionFund. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizers and insecticides for her farmland. She hopes to make healthy rice to increase her family’s income so as to make a better living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and insecticides for her farmland.

loans.name: Thav's Group

texts.en:
Living in a rural area located in the Moung Russey district of Battambang province, Thav is 53 years old, married, and has one child. To support her family, she and her husband have been farming rice and planting various types of vegetables for five years. From the current business, Thav and her husband can earn about 14,000KHR per day and can save about 9,000KHR each day for their future needs. 

This is the group loan for Thav’s group of two members with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. She is a second-cycle client. The first loan has helped her to better support her family. Now she and her group member are applying for a loan of 1,000,000KHR each. As the leader, Thav wants to use her portion to buy sesame seeds for planting. With this loan, she hopes to grow her rice, as well as her sesame, healthfully so as to sell them for good prices to fulfill her dream of having a decent house for living in.

loans.use: to buy sesame seeds for planting

loans.name: Pret

texts.en:
Pret is age 55 and is living with his family members in a rural village located in the Thmor Koul district of Battambang province. He is married with three children, all of whom are dependents and still in school. Rice farming on five hectares of farmland has been the only main source for his family’s income for thirty years. Lacking working capital to buy fertilizer for applying to his farmland is the main challenge for his farming business. 

Pret has been with VisionFund for four loan cycles. He successfully used the loans from VisionFund to improve his family’s living condition and now he is confident of making a better living. Requesting a loan with VisionFund of US$800, Pret will use this loan to buy fertilizers and pesticides for his farmland. He hopes to grow his rice healthily and fruitfully so as to sell it for a good price to improve his family’s lifestyle and keep his children in school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and pesticides for his farmland.

loans.name: Sokheng

texts.en:
Age 40 years, Sokheang is a married mother of six children living in the Prey Chhor district of Kampong Cham province. Of her children, five are dependent on her. Three are in school while the other two are still too young for school. Sokheng is a rice farmer who grows rice on 2.5 hectares of farmland. She has been in the business for twenty-two years and she can earn about 36,000KHR per day and can save about 10,000KHR each day after daily expenses.

This is the second loan for Sokheng with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund.  She completely paid back the first loan, which has helped her better support her family. Now she is applying for a loan of 3,000,000KHR. With this loan, she wants to buy fertilizer and rice seeds for her farmland. This loan will enable her to extend her farmland so as to increase her rice production to increase her family’s income and she hopes to improve her family’s living conditions and keep her children in school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and rice seeds for her farmland.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Sophea's Group

texts.en:
Living in a rural village located in the Kampong province’s Dambae district, Sophea is 25 and married with one daughter. For the last five years, she has been planting cassava as the primary business for her family. To add more income, she also sells grocery items in a local area. The current business earns her about KHR65,000 per day to make a living, and she can save about KHR35,000 each day for future needs.
 
She has been with VisionFund for three cycles while the other member has been with VisionFund for five cycles. She completely paid back the loans which have helped her better support her current business. Now she is leading her group to request another new loan of KHR1,400,000 each. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy pesticides for her farmland, and she will use a portion of it to spend on plowing the rice field. She hopes to get a high yield from her farming business so as to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy pesticides for her farmland.

loans.name: Vannarin

texts.en:
A villager from the Kampong Cham province’s Ponhea Krek district, Vannarin is 34 years old and married with two children, both of whom are still in school. To make a living, he has been planting rubber and cassava for almost ten years as his primary business. The current business earns him about 70,000KHR per day and he manages to save about 30,000KHR each day after daily expenses. 

This is the first loan for Vannarin with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. He is now applying for a loan of 3,000,000KHR to buy a plot of farmland. He hopes this loan enables him to increase his crop yields and sell it for a good price to improve his standards of living and to keep his children in school.

loans.use: to buy a plot of farmland

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Jonathan

texts.en:
Jonathan grows rice crops on his one hectare of farmland. He has run this kind of business for four years. Aside from farming, he has also engaged himself in a livestock business.

He is a widower who has been blessed with two children. He is an ex-Overseas Filipino worker (OFW) of Saudi as an electrician supervisor, but since his wife died due to stroke, Jonathan decided to stay with his family here in the Philippines. He acts as both the father and mother to his two children who are currently studying at this time. He aspires to have a viable source of income so he could let his children finish their studies.

Jonathan would like to request an additional capital amount of PHP30,000, allowing him to buy necessary fertilizer and to pay hired laborers for transplanting. He just hopes that his farming business will continue to improve so he could earn greater income for his family's needs.

loans.use: to pay hired laborers for transplanting and to purchase fertilizer for his rice field.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy groceries such as canned goods, noodles, fish paste and cooking oil, and to buy feeds for her pigs.

loans.name: Yot's Group

texts.en:
Originally from a rural village located in the Kror Kor district of Pursat province, Yot is 28 years old and married. He has three children, all of whom are dependent on him and still in school. To make a living, he has been working as a rice farmer on one hectare of farmland for several years and supplements his income by catching fish. Yot can earn about 15,000 KHR per day and save about 8,000 KHR each day for future needs.

This is a group loan for Yot with VisionFund and he has been a member of VisionFund for one cycle already. He completely paid back the loan, which has helped him better support his family’s living. Now he and his group member are applying for a loan of 1,200,000 KHR each. As the leader, he wants to use his portion to buy supplies for his fishing business. He hopes to catch more fishes so as to sell them for a good price to better his lifestyle and keep his children in school.

loans.use: To buy supplies for his fishing business.

loans.name: Saroen's Group

texts.en:
Saroen, 32, lives with her family members in a rural village of the Pursat province’s Kror kor district, Cambodia. She has three dependent children who are still in school. For the last 12 years, she and her husband have been farming rice and raising pigs as the main sources of their family’s income. The current business earns her about KHR20,000  per day.
This is the second loan for Saroen’s group of three with VisionFund. The past loans have helped her better support her family with sufficient foods. She and her group are applying for a loan. As the leader, she will use her portion to buy pig feed for nourishing them and use a portion of it to spend on buying a plot of farmland for expanding her farming business. She hopes to fatten her pig so as to sell them for a good price to improve her standard of living and keep her children in school.

loans.use: to buy pig feed for nourishing them.

loans.name: Thanh

texts.en:
Thanh was born in 1980. She has three children. They are at secondary school and primary school. Her husband and she sell tobacco. She gets 4,000,000 VND a month. Her family’s total earnings are about 7,500,000 VND per month.
She has participated in SEDA's credit program since 2007. In the last cycle she borrowed 9,632,000 VND and repaid the loan on time. In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow 10,080,000 VND to buy ingredients to make tobacco. She wants to raise her children well so they are able to get a job in the future.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to make tobacco.

loans.name: Hao

texts.en:
Hao was born in 1959. She has three children who are carpenters and a kindergarten teacher. Her oldest child has gotten married. Her husband is dead. She raises chickens to earn a living. She earns from it 3,000,000 VND a month. Her family’s total earnings are about 10,000,000 VND per month.
She has participated in SEDA's credit program since 2007. In the last cycle she borrowed 9,632,000 VND and repaid the loan on time. In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow 9,632,000 VND to buy food for her chickens. She has always wanted to enlarge her chicken farm.

loans.use: to buy food for her chickens.

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en:
Leonora is 37 years old and is married to Ramon, a farmer. Together they raise four children. They are both engaged in a farming business, planting and harvesting rice to sell. Leonora earns about 10,000 PHP per harvest (twice a year). 

Leonora aims to improve the income generated from the business and asks for a loan of 20,000 PHP to help improve the growth and nutrition of her crops. She will buy pesticides and insecticides used in farming and pay for labor. 

Someday, Leonora hopes to become a successful rice grower in her village and lift her family out of poverty.

loans.use: to buy rice seeds, pesticides and insecticides used in farming and pay for labor.

loans.name: Nida

texts.en:
Nida is 51 years old, married and peacefully living at Solana. They have a farming business which she has operated for over 10 years now. They plant and harvest rice to sell. She earns PHP 10,000, approximately, per harvest season which is twice a year. 

She is now asking for a loan of PHP 20,000 to buy insecticides and pesticides to be used in farming. 

Someday, with good harvest, Nida hopes to achieve a profitable farming business and save funds for her family's future expenses.

loans.use: to buy insecticides and pesticides to be used in farming.

loans.name: Sonia

texts.en: Sonia is a rice grower from Solana. She is 47 years old and married. She lives with her spouse and three children. With her husband, she plants and harvests rice to sell to traders. She aims for more crop production but has insufficient funds to support her crops' needs for fertilizers and insecticides. Sonia is asking for a loan of P20,000 to buy insecticides and fertilizers. She hopes to keep growing rice and achieve more income and be a successful farmer to lift her family out of poverty.

loans.use: to buy insecticides and fertilizers for use in farming

loans.name: Ha

texts.en:
Ha was born in 1984. She has three children. The two older children are learning at a primary school. Her youngest child has just been born. Her husband and her do carpentry to earn a living. They have done this job for eight years. She gets 5,000,000 VND a month from it. Her family’s total earnings are about 10,000,000 VND per month. 

Ha has participated in SEDA's credit program since 2009. In the last cycle, she borrowed 5,152,000 VND and repaid the loan on time. In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow 8,736,000 VND to buy wood to make furniture and sell. Her dreams are for her children to have good careers and to enlarge her wood workshop.

loans.use: to buy wood to make furniture

loans.name: Vu

texts.en:
Vu was born in 1969. She has two children, who are learning at secondary school and primary school. Vu and her husband are carpenters. She is also a nurse. Her income is about 7,000,000 dong [VND]. Her family’s total earnings are about 12,000,000 VND per month.

She has participated in SEDA's credit program since 2007. In the last cycle she borrowed 9,632,000 VND and repaid the loan on time. In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow 10,080,000 VND to buy wood for carpentry. She always wants to raise her children well and enlarge her wood workshop.

loans.use: to buy wood for use in carpentry.

loans.name: Hanh's Group

texts.en:
Hanh was born in 1983. She has two daughters and a son who are all under ten years old. Her husband is a mechanic. She has a grocery store to earn a living. Her income is about 4,000,000 VND and her family’s total earnings are about 11,000,000 VND per month. 

Hanh has participated in SEDA's credit program since 2008. In the last cycle she borrowed 8,288,000 VND and repaid the loan on time. In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow 6,048,000 VND to buy noodles, rice and salt to sell in her grocery store. She wants to raise her children well and enlarge her grocery store.

Nguyen was born in 1984. She would like to borrow 6,944,000 VND for carpentry.

loans.use: to buy noodles, rice and salt to sell in her grocery store.

loans.name: Tinh

texts.en:
Tinh was born in 1962. She has two children who are adults. Her husband is a constructor. She is a carpenter. She raises chickens and gets about 3,000,000 VND per month. Her family’s total earnings are about 12,000,000 VND per month. 
She has participated in SEDA's credit program since 2007. In the last cycle she borrowed 9,632,000 VND and repaid the loan on time. In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow 10,080,000 VND to buy wood for her carpentry workshop. She wants to use the profits to save for her retirement.

loans.use: to buy wood for her carpentry workshop.

loans.name: Hoa

texts.en:
Hoa was born in 1976. She has two sons. The oldest son is a student, and the younger son is in the 10th grade. Her husband and she do carpentry to earn a living. She earns from it 5,000,000 VND a month. Her family’s total earnings are about 12,000,000 VND per month.
She has participated in SEDA's credit program since 2008. In the last cycle she borrowed 9,184,000 VND and repaid the loan on time. In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow 10,080,000 VND to buy wood to make furniture and to sell. She always wants to raise her children well and get well-paid jobs in the future.

loans.use: to buy wood to make furniture and to sell.

loans.name: Bardhe

texts.en:
Bardhe lives in a little rural village in northern Albania. She is in her 60s and has four children. She was a school teacher until she retired, after which she started a completely new activity: producing corn, wheat and oats and selling these products to flour factories. This activity has turned out to be very profitable because the flour is used to make bread and Albanians are good consumers of bread. Note that bread with a bit of dairy is a staple for poor Albanian families. 

Not only is Bardhe happy with the income she has earned from this activity; she is also enjoying the whole process from plowing the soil to watering, planting and harvesting.

Bardhe needs a loan to drain land that has been flooded by heavy rains in the past few months. She requests 100,000 Albanian lek and said that she would be very grateful if she was offered some financial help from Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to drain agricultural land that has been flooded by heavy rains

loans.name: Braulio

texts.es: El señor Braulio tiene 29 años de edad estado civil soltero actualmente vive con sus padres, pero económicamente es independiente, se dedica a la actividad agrícola en terreno de 4 Has que es herencia de sus padres, produce papa, zapallo, locoto con rotación de cultivos. Tiene mucha experiencia en el rubro, Corani Pampa se encuentra a 75 km de la ciudad de Cochabamba, Braulio necesita un crédito de urgencia para comprar insumos agrícolas abono orgánico y productos agroquímicos, el ahorro que tenía gasto en la reparación del motor de su camión. El señor Braulio comprará los agroquímicos para realizar el tratamiento fitosanitarios de sus cultivos y garantizar la seguridad alimentaria de la población y seguirá ahorrando para construir su propia vivienda y formar una familia a futuro.
texts.en:
Braulio is 29 years old and single.  He currently lives with his parents but economically he is independent.  He makes a living in agriculture on a plot of land of 4 hectares that is the inheritance of his parents.  He produces potatoes, pumpkins and peppers with crop rotation.  He has a lot of experience in the field.  Corani Pampa is located 75 kilometers from the city of Cochabamba.  

Braulio is in urgent need of a loan to buy agricultural supplies like organic fertilizer and agrochemical products.  He spent the savings that he had on repairing the engine of his truck.  Braulio will buy the agrochemicals to carry out phytosanitary treatments of his crops and guarantee the food supply of the population and will continue saving to build his own home and form a family in the future.

loans.use: to purchase agrochemicals and organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Mariano Rosa

texts.es:
El socio Mariano Rosa se dedica al negocio de crianza de animales,el socio cria cuyes,el socio los hace crecer y engordar y luego los vende en los diferentes mercados donde venden cuyes,el socio trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,el socio ya tiene 9 años en este negocio y le va muy bien,el sueño del socio es tener un local donde pueda vender los cuyes.El socio solicita el credito para comprar alimentos para los cuyes y comprar cuyes.

El socio esta feliz con el credito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de suc cuota.
texts.en:
The member, Mariano Rosa, makes a living raising animals.  He raises guinea pigs: he makes them grow and fattens them, then sells them in the various markets where guinea pigs are sold.  He works from 8 a.m. until 6 p.m.  He has had this business for nine years and it's going very well for him.

His dream is to have a place where he can sell the guinea pigs.

He's requesting this loan to buy guinea pigs and guinea pig feed.  He's happy about this loan and is committed to making his payments on time.

loans.use: to buy guinea pigs and feed

loans.name: Didber

texts.es:
El socio Didber se dedica al negocio de transporte,el socio tiene un taxi donde realiza servicio de taxi,el socio trabaja en las diferentes calles de la ciudad,el socio trabaja desde las 7:00 a.m hasta las 10:00 p.m,el socio ya tiene 6 años en este negocio y le va muy bien,el sueño del socio es tener un carro nuevo.El socio solicita el credito para comprar llantas para su carro.

El socio esta feliz con el credito otordao y se compromete a cumplir los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member, Didber, makes a living in the transportation business.  He has a taxi for providing taxi service.  He works in the various streets of the city from 7 a.m. until 10 p.m.  He has been in this business for six years and it's going very well for him.  His dream is to have a new car.

He's requesting the loan to buy tires for his car.

He's happy about this loan and is committed to making his payments on time.

loans.use: to buy tires

loans.name: Jose Luis

texts.es:
El señor Jose Luis esta casado, tiene 33 años de edad, cursó los 3 años de educación primaria, tiene 2 hijos 1 de los cuales está estudiando, se dedica a la elaboración de muebles, inicio este trabajo siendo operario para otro negocio, y hasta el momento lleva 14 años de experiencia, cuenta con la ayuda de su esposa ella se dedica a los oficios del hogar.

Decide solicitar un préstamo que lo utilizara para la compra de herramientas de trabajo, espera seguir mejorando su taller, ya que quiere capitalizar y tener buenas ganancias, dando si una buena condición de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Jose Luis is married and 33 years old.  He completed 3 years of primary school education, and he has 2 children, one of whom is currently in school.  He is a carpenter for a living, and he makes all kinds of furniture.  He started this business when he was an employee at another business, and he now has 14 years of experience.  He also has the help of his wife who takes care of the domestic needs.

He decided to ask for a loan that will help him to buy tools for work.  He hopes to continue to improve his shop with better income, and to provide good living conditions for his family.

loans.use: to buy tools for his carpentry business.

loans.name: Leona Feliciana

texts.es:
La señora Leona Feliciana esta casada, tiene 32 años de edad, no tuvo la oportunidad estudiar, tiene 4 hijos los cuales estudian, se dedica al tejido de cortes típicos, inició  este trabajo gracias al apoyo de sus padres, y hasta el momento lleva 19 años de experiencia, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien se dedica al mismo trabajo.

Solicitar un préstamo, que tendrá como destino la compra de hilo de diferentes clases y colores, ya que espera que su negocio sea rentable, con mejores ingresos, para mejorar sus ingresos familiares y tener trabajadores para su taller de tejidos, apoyando así a generar fuentes de trabajo para otras personas..
texts.en:
Leona Feliciana is married and 32 years old.  She didn't have a chance to study in school, but she has 4 children who are all in school.  She is a weaver.  She began this work thanks to the support of her parents, and to date she has 19 years of experience in this livelihood.  Her husband also does the same type of work and they support each other.  

She decided to ask for a loan, that will help her to invest in buying different types of thread of different colors and types, since she hopes that her business will be profitable and make more money to increase her family's income and to hire employees, which will help generate jobs for other people.

loans.use: to buy thread of different colors and types

loans.name: Rebeca Florinda

texts.es:
La señora Rebeca Florinda esta casada, tiene 39 años de edad, cursó los 2 años de educación primaria, tiene 4 hijos 1 de los cuales esta estudiando, se dedica a la tejeduría, inicio este trabajo como operaria y hasta el momento lleva casi 21 años de experiencia, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien la apoya económicamente.

Solicita un préstamo que lo utilizara para la compra de hilos de diferentes colores y labores de diferentes diseños, las cuales son utilizadas para el tejido de cortes típicos, espera mejorar su negocio, ya que en el futuro espera que sus hijos mantengan este trabajo, y puedan incrementar su capital y sus ganancias.
texts.en:
Señora Rebeca Florinda is married. She went to primary school for two years and has four children, one of whom is in school. She is a weaver and started this work as an operator. She now has 21 years of experience and counts on her husband's support; he supports her economically.

She is requesting a loan which she will use to purchase different color thread and designs, which she uses for traditional sewing styles.  She hopes to better her business and that her children will one day take over and increase their income.

loans.use: to purchase different color thread and designs

loans.name: Sirenachayoc Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “SIRENACHAYOC”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Feliciana ella es casada y tiene 67 años y tiene 3 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de venta de artesanía, la socia realiza trabajos como telares, mantas y guantes, la socia los teje y los distribuye a las diferentes tiendas que venden artesanía, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m,la socia se dedica a este negocio 8 años y le gusta tejer, por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender los trabajos de artesanía. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar lanas, palitos de tejer y hilos de colores.
La socia que esta pegada a la foto grupal se le tomo despues la foto, porque pidio permiso por motivos de trabajo.
Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de artesanía, negocio de venta de productos de belleza, negocio de servicio de taxi y negocio de venta de granos secos.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members belong to the “Sirenachayoc” communal bank located in Cusco District belonging to Cusco Province and Department.  Feliciana, 67, is married and has three children.  She works in her business selling crafts.  She knits such things as blankets and mittens; she knits them and then distributes them to various stores that sell crafts.  She works from 8am until 7pm and has been in business 8 years; she enjoys knitting and is able to support her children this way.  Her dream is to have a locale where she can sell her crafts.  She’s requesting the loan to buy wool, knitting needles and colored yearn.  She is grateful to those who share her dream by this means and commits to make her payments as scheduled.

The member who appears in the inserted photo took her picture after the group photo was taken; she asked permission due to work.  The other members sell crafts, beauty products, provide taxi service and sell dry grains.

loans.use: to buy wool, knitting needles and colored yarn.

loans.name: Jose Rolando

texts.es:
El señor Jose Rolando  esta casado, tiene 42 años de edad, estudio los 5 años de educación primaria, tiene 3 hijos los cuales tan estudiando, se dedica a la atención de un restaurante, inicio este negocio, con un poco de capital y hasta el momento lleva 7 años de experiencia, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposa quien se dedica  a la atención de un comedor.

Solicita un préstamo, que sera utilizado para la compra de insumos para su negocio, ya que quiere disponer de toda clase de comida, el dinero lo va usar para la compra de carnes, verduras, condimentos, bebidas, etc. Espera en el futuro tener otros  negocios, para mejorar sus ganancias.
texts.en:
José Rolando’s married; he’s 45-years-old.  He attended five years of elementary school.  He has three children attending school.  He runs a restaurant.  He started this business with a little capital and to date has 7 years’ experience.  His wife helps him out; she works running a dining room.

He’s requesting a loan that will be used to buy ingredients for his business because he wants to have all kinds of food available.  He will use the money to buy meats, vegetables, condiments, beverages, etc.  He hopes in future to have other businesses in order to improve his profits.

loans.use: to buy ingredients.

loans.name: Juan Miguel

texts.es:
el señor Juan Miguel esta casado, tiene 31 años de edad, cursó los 5 años de educacion primaria, tiene 1 hijo pequeño, se dedica a la sastrería, inicio este negocio cuando tuvo la oportunidad de tener un pco de capital y hasta el momento lleva 11 años de experiencia, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposa quien se dedica al mismo trabajo.

Solicita un préstamo, le servirá para la compra de una maquina de costura plana, para que de es forma pueda producir mas playeras en sus diferentes diseños. Espera en el futuro tener un negocio grande y con capital propio
texts.en:
Señor Juan Miguel is married. He is 31 years old. He completed five years of primary education, and he has a little son. He works as a tailor. He began this business when he had the opportunity to have a little capital, and so far he has had 11 years of experience. He has the assistance of his wife, who does the same work.

He is applying for a loan that will serve for the purchase of a flat bed sewing machine, so that in this way he can produce more garments of his various designs. He hopes in the future to have a big business with his own capital.

loans.use: to buy a flat-bed sewing machine

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy daily-use products for the store and food for her chickens and pigs

loans.name: Enrique Gonzalo

texts.es:
Enrique es un hombre muy trabajador, vive al lado de su esposa quien se dedica a sus labores como ama de casa, juntos tienen 4 hijos,  cuyas edades comprenden entre 3 y 9 años. Su vivienda se ubica en la calurosa ciudad de Nazca, en la cual se puede encontrar muchos atractivos turisticos como por ejemplo las lineas de Nazca. Debiso a su bajos recursos solo pudo estudiar hasta el quinto grado de educacion secundaria, pero le hubiera  gustado estudiar la carrera de  arquitectura.

Dia a dia Enrique trabaja como albañil, el labora alrededor de 8 horas al dia ya que con este trabajo puede solventar con mucho esfuerzo  a su familia; el cree que le va bien en su trabajo porque es muy responsable y realizar acabados de buena calidad.

Enrique agradece mucho a los prestatarios Kiva por la ayuda que le han brindado ya que gracias a ello podra iniciar su negocio de venta de abarrotes, ya que con el credito podra comprar mercaderia como arroz, azucar, fideos, atun, entre otros y asi poder ofrecer variedad de productos a sus clientes; de esta manera el podra seguir luchando para poder hacer realidad su mas grande sueño: “ construir su vivienda de 2 pisos”.
texts.en:
Enrique is a very hard-working man. He lives with his wife, who is a homemaker. Together they have 4 children, whose ages are between 3 and 9. His home is located in the hot city of Nazca, where many tourist attractions such as the Nazca lines are found. Because of his limited resources, he was only able to go to school through the fifth year of secondary education, but he would have liked to study architecture.

Enrique works every day as a bricklayer. He works about 8 hours a day, since with this work and with much effort he is able to support his family. He feels that his work is going well for him because he is very responsible and completes projects of good quality.

Enrique very much appreciates the Kiva lenders for the help that they have offered him, since thanks to this he will be able to begin his grocery-selling business. With the loan he will be able to buy merchandise such as rice, sugar, pasta, and tuna, among other items, and thus be able to offer a variety of products to his customers. In this way he will be able to continue working to make his greatest dream a reality: to construct a two-story home.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for his store -- rice, sugar, pasta, tuna, etc.

loans.name: Dúo Roca Fuerte Group

texts.es: DUO ROCA FUERTE ESTA CONFORMADO POR DON ROCAEL ES PROPIETARIO DE UN TALLER DE ELECTROMECANICA.  DON ROCAEL ESTA ESPECIALIZADO EN LA ELECTROMECANICA Y DESDE HACE MAS DE 10 AÑOS SE DEDICA A ESTE OFICIO Y LUCHA Y TRABAJA ARDUAMENTE PARA SALIR ADELANTE Y ASI PODER DARLE LO MEJOR A SU FAMILIA. EL ESTÁ SOLICITANDO ESTE CREDITO PARA LA COMPRA DE REPUESTOS PARA SU TALLER ESPERA QUE LE PUEDAN AYUDAR CON EL CREDITO SOLICITADO Y DESDE YA LES DESEA UN FELIZ AÑO NUEVO Y MUCHAS BENDICIONES.
texts.en: Rocael is a member of this duo.  He owns an electronics repair shop; he’s a specialist in electro mechanics and has been in this occupation for more than ten years.  He works hard and strives to get ahead and to provide the best for his family this way.  He’s requesting this loan to buy spare parts for his shop.  He hopes to be helped with the requested loan and he wishes you a happy new year and many blessings.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for his electronics repair shop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy batteries and fuel filters.

loans.name: Las Elegidas  - 32 Group

texts.es: El Banco de emprendimiento LAS ELEGIDAS  - 32 está  compuesto por ocho integrantes siete  mujeres y un varón, todos ellos se dedican a distintas actividades,  la presidenta del banco es la Sra. Arminda tiene 31 años y tiene dos hijos de la edad de 5 y 3 años, ella se dedica a la venta de variedad de cortinas, agarradores de cortinas en su puesto de venta que se encuentra en una de las ferias más concurridas de la ciudad de Cochabamba,   este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra. Arminda va a usar este préstamo para la compra de Cortinas al por mayor y  de esta manera surtir su puesto de venta y brindar variedad de productos  a sus clientes,  ya que esta época de fin de año es donde tiene más demanda y ella quiere aprovechar para así también generar mayores ingresos ya que por Navidad también tiene muchos gastos en su casa comprando regalos y ropa para sus hijitos.
texts.en: Communal Bank LAS ELEGIDAS  - 32 is comprised of eight members: seven women and one man, who all make a living from different activities. The president of the bank is Arminda who is 31 years old and who has two children ages 5 and 3. She works selling a variety of curtains and curtain hooks in her retail post which is at one of the most popular markets in the city of Cochabamba. This is her first loan series at the institution. Arminda will use this loan to buy wholesale curtains and that way stock her retail post and offer a variety of products to her clients. Because the end of the year season has more demand, she wants to take advantage so that she may also be able to generate more earnings because Christmas also has a lot of household expenses like buying gifts and clothing for her little children.

loans.use: to buy wholesale curtains

loans.name: Vilma Milagros

texts.es:
A young entrepreneur of only 19 years, Vilma is a hard working young woman who wants to improve her business while continuing her education in a local university. Even at such a young age, she is as dedicated to her customers as she is to her future career as an accountant. In six months, she hopes to qualify as a professional accountant.

As anyone who has visited Peru`s coastal region can attest, the region does not lack for warmth—in the people and in the weather. Vilma sells refreshments to a very thirsty clientele, and  is proud that her products are high quality and affordable. 

Vilma feels a deep gratitude to her Kiva lenders for their generosity in helping her achieve her dreams. With her loan, she can repair her refreshment car in order to attract even more customers, and consequently dedicate more of her resources to her education and professional pursuits.
texts.en:
A young entrepreneur of only 19 years, Vilma is a hard working young woman who wants to improve her business while continuing her education in a local university. Even at such a young age, she is as dedicated to her customers as she is to her future career as an accountant. In six months, she hopes to qualify as a professional accountant.

As anyone who has visited Peru`s coastal region can attest, the region does not lack for warmth—in the people and in the weather. Vilma sells refreshments to a very thirsty clientele, and  is proud that her products are high quality and affordable. 

Vilma feels a deep gratitude to her Kiva lenders for their generosity in helping her achieve her dreams. With her loan, she can repair her refreshment car in order to attract even more customers, and consequently dedicate more of her resources to her education and professional pursuits.

loans.use: to repair her cart.

loans.name: Maria Armenia

texts.es: La señora Maria Armenia de 24 años, casada y tiene dos hijas, su esposo es piloto de camion de cargas pesada no depende de una empresa ya que el camion es de el o sea de su esposos,  doña Armenia se dedica a la venta de ropa para niños y dama desde hace tres años en el mercado municipal de Santiago, ella vende suerteres, blusas, camisas, pantalones, también uniformes de los diferentes establecimientos escolares públicos, ahora en esta época  necesita  invertir en bufandas mas suéteres, también quiere comprar mas diseños, colores  o estilos desea variar su negocio, su sueño es que sus hijas estudien y sean mujeres profesionales , esta solicitando este credito para la compra de ropa nueva para la venta.
texts.en: Maria Armenia is 24 years old, married, and has two daughters.  Her husband drives a heavy cargo truck and is not dependent on one company since he owns the truck.  Armenia sells children’s and ladies’ clothing and has been doing so for three years in the Santiago market.  She sells sweaters, blouses, shirts, pants, and uniforms for different public schools.  Now she needs to invest in scarves for the season, more sweaters of more colors, styles, and designs.  She wants to have more of an assortment.  Her dream is for her daughters to study and become professional women.  She is asking for this loan to buy new clothing to sell.

loans.use: to buy clothing for resale.

loans.name: Nancy Lia

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Banco Comunal Los Compañeros.

En este lugar vive la señora Nancy, tiene 56 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen cuatro hijos todos mayores de edad e independientes. Su esposo es profesor.

Doña Nancy es una mujer muy trabajadora que siempre le gusto trabajar para ayudar a sus esposo a salir adelante y para darles una muy buena educación a sus hijos, ella hace varios años empezó un negocio de venta de comidas el mismo que con el paso del tiempo fue mejorando y aumentando hasta tener un gran restaurant, prepara deliciosos platos que vende en su local, además prepara bocadillos y comidas para fiestas y compromisos sociales, con ella  trabaja con 8 personas las cuales reciben un sueldo mensual por su trabajo, tiene este negocio por más de 22 años razón por la cual tiene muchos pedidos y clientes que a diario asisten a su restaurante a servirse los mejores platos de la ciudad.

Este crédito lo va utilizar en comprar arroz, carne, pescado y otros víveres para la preparación de los alimentos. Está en el Banco Comunal desde el inicio, es la presidenta del grupo y le gusta porque los créditos son rápidos y de mucha ayuda.
 
Su meta es seguir adelante en su negocio.
texts.en:
The members of the Los Compañeros communal bank meet every two weeks in the city of Portoviejo, capital of Manabí, known as the city of the royal tamarinds.  Nancy lives here.  She is 56 years old, married, and has four adult children on their own.  Her husband is a teacher.

Nancy is a hardworking woman who always liked working to help her husband get ahead and provide a good education for their children.  She started her food business several years ago, and over time improved it until she had a great restaurant.  She prepares her delicious dishes that she sells from her stand and for parties and social gatherings.  She works with eight people who receive a monthly salary.  She has had this business for more than 22 years and this is why she has many orders and customers who visit her restaurant each day to have her quality dishes.

She will use the money from this loan to buy rice, meat, fish and other foods to prepare her dishes.  She has been with the communal bank since the beginning and is the group’s president.  She likes it because of the quick loans and help.

Her goal is to continue her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients.

loans.name: Vicuñitas 2010 Chacaltaya Group

texts.es: El Banco de emprendimiento VICUÑITAS 2010 CHACALTAYA está  compuesto por nueve integrantes seis  mujeres y tres  varones, todos ellos se dedican a distintas actividades,  la presidenta del banco es la Sra. Josefa tiene 35 años y tiene cinco hijos de la edades de 16, 12, 10, 8  y 4 años, la Sra. Josefa  es de ocupación carpintera trabaja junto a su esposo quien también es carpintero y quien le enseño este oficio tiene su propio taller ubicado en la zona de Zenkata,  el destino del crédito es para la compra de madera al por mayor ya que tiene que realizar entregas de muebles  la Sra. Josefa es una persona muy trabajadora se siente agradecida con la institución por el apoyo que se le ha brindado ya que ella está orgullosa de trabajar ya que este oficio generalmente es de varones y ella salió adelante y se siente feliz porque traspaso estas barreras que lo logro a base de mucha perseverancia.
texts.en:
The VICUÑITAS 2010 CHACALTAYA entrepreneurial bank is made up of nine members; six women and three men.  All have different businesses.  Josefa is the president of the bank and she is 35 years old and has five children, ages 16, 12, 10, 8, and 4. She is a carpenter and works with her husband who is also a carpenter and who taught her this trade.  She has her own business in the Zenkata zone and will use the money from this loan to buy lumber in quantity so that she can fill some orders for furniture.

Josefa is a hardworking woman who is very grateful for the support from the institution and is proud to be able to work in this trade that is normally a man’s trade.  She has gotten ahead and is happy to have broken these barriers with her perseverance.

loans.use: to buy lumber.

loans.name: Matilde Etelvina

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Banco Comunal Los Compañeros.

En este lugar vive la señora Matilde, tiene 34 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen una hija de un año y tres meses la cual es su razón de vida, actualmente está en su sexto mes de embarazo de su segundo hijo. Su esposo es guardia de seguridad.

Doña Matilde para ganar algo propio y con esto poder ayudar con los gastos que genera el hogar, se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo y hace poco con el crédito anterior empezó con ventas de sandalias y zapatos de niños, su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta, ella sale dos a tres días por semana a recorrer por toda la ciudad ofreciendo sus productos, trabaja todos los días ya que también vende en su  casa hasta donde llegan sus clientes más conocidos. Su mercadería la va a comprar a  Guayaquil cada vez que necesita. Tiene 7 años que se dedica a esta actividad y le ha ido muy bien, por lo general lo que más vende son prendas de damas.

Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar más mercadería como: pantalones, blusas, camisetas y ropa de niños. Este es su segundo ciclo en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque con los créditos cada vez aumenta su negocio.
 
Su sueño es tener bien arreglada su casa con todas las comodidades.
texts.en:
The members of the Los Compañeros communal bank meet every two weeks in the city of Portoviejo, capital of Manabí, known as the city of the royal tamarinds.  Matilde lives here.  She is 34 years old, married, and has a one year old daughter.  Her husband is a security guard.

Matilde, in order to earn an income and help her husband with the household expenses, sells all types of clothing.  She recently used the money from a previous loan to start selling children’s sandals and shoes around the city, two days a week.  She also sells from her home, where her best customers visit her.  She buys her merchandise in Guayaquil whenever she needs to and has been doing this for seven years.  Things have gone well for her.  Most of her sales are women’s clothing.

She will use the money from this loan to buy items such as pants, blouses, t-shirts, and children’s clothing.  This will be her second cycle in the communal bank and she likes it because she improves her business more with each loan.

She hopes to be able to fix up her home with all the comforts.

loans.use: to buy clothing for resale.

loans.name: Flor Leida

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Banco Comunal Los Compañeros.

En este lugar vive la señora flor, tiene 32 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene cinco  hijos de 12, 10, 9  y  dos que son gemelos de 7 años de edad, el mayor estudia en colegio y los menores en escuela. El marido es mecánico automotriz y trabaja en un taller.
 
Doña Flor  es una muy buena ama de casa que para ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar y de los estudios de sus hijos mprase dedica a  preparar y vender bocadillos y comida rápida como: empanadillas, cueritos, corviches, jugos, batidos de frutas y sodas, entre otras cosas, ella espera recibir este crédito porque lo quiere invertir en adecuar un local más grande y comprar ciertos utensilios de cocina para empezar a vender comida por las tardes y con esto poder obtener más ganancias por el bien de sus hijos que es lo más importante para ella.
  
Este crédito lo va utilizar en comprar utensilios de cocina y víveres para la preparación de los alimentos. Lleva tres ciclos en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por la ayuda que le brindan los créditos.
 
Sus sueños son tener un gran restaurante y que a sus hijos nunca les falte nada.
texts.en:
The members of the Los Compañeros communal bank meet every two weeks in the city of Portoviejo, capital of Manabí, known as the city of the royal tamarinds.  Flor lives here.  She is 32 years old, is in a common law marriage, and has five children, ages 12, 10, 9 and a set of 7 year old twins.  Her husband is an automotive mechanic and works in a workshop.

Flor is a good housewife who prepares and sells snacks in order to help out with the household expenses and her children’s education.  She makes empanadas, pork rinds, corciches, juices, fruit smoothies, and sodas among other things.  She hopes to receive this loan so that she can buy certain kitchen utensils and ingredients to prepare her food in the evening and to increase her profit.  The wellbeing of her children is the most important thing to her.

She has had three cycles with the communal bank and likes it because of the loans she gets.  Her dreams are to have a grand restaurant and for her children never to be in need of anything.

loans.use: to buy supplies and ingredients.

loans.name: Brígida Auxiliadora

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Banco Comunal Los Compañeros.

En este lugar vive señora Brígida, tiene 38 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene seis  hijos de 17, 16, 14, 10, 9 y 6  años de edad,  la mayor estudia en universidad, dos en colegio y los menores en escuela. El marido tiene un taller de ebanistería.
 
Doña Brígida con la intención de ganar algo por su cuenta y con esto poder salir adelante en el hogar se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo, zapatos y sabanas, ella realiza sus ventas puerta a puerta y en ocasiones en un restaurante de la ciudad en la cual trabaja y por lo cual recibe un sueldo mensual, en sus ventas también le ayuda su hija la misma que lleva la mercadería a vender a sus compañeras de clases, ella a deja a crédito a sus clientes  y cobra cada quince días. Su mercadería  la va a comprar a  Guayaquil cada quince días o al mes de acuerdo a lo que necesite. Tiene 3 años que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien, es así como ella reúne sus ganancias las cuales las utiliza en los estudios de sus hijos ya que para ella es lo más importante.

Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar ropa, zapatos y sabanas para provechar la época de Navidad y Año Nuevo que es cuando más vende. Está en el Banco Comunal desde hace 3 ciclos  y le gusta por la ayuda que le dan los créditos.
 
Su sueño es ver que sus hijos terminen sus estudios y sean buenos profesionales,
texts.en:
The members of the Los Compañeros communal bank meet every two weeks in the city of Portoviejo, capital of Manabí, known as the city of the royal tamarinds.  Brígida lives here.  She is 38 years old, is in a common law marriage, and has six children, ages 17, 16, 14, 10, 9, and 6.  Her oldest daughter studies at university, two in high school, and the youngest ones in elementary school.  Her husband is has a cabinet making workshop.


Brígida sells all types of clothing, shoes, and sheets in order to earn an income and get ahead in her home.  She sells her merchandise from door to door and sometimes at a restaurant in the city where she works and from where she receives a monthly salary.  Her daughter also helps her with her sales and takes merchandise to sell to her school friends.  She sells on credit and collects every two weeks or once a month, depending on the agreement.  She has been doing this for three years and things are going well for her.  This is the way she makes money, which she uses to pay for her children’s education, which she considers to be the most important thing.


She will use the money from this loan to buy clothing, shoes, and sheets for the Christmas and New Year seasons.  This is when she sells the most.  She has been with the communal bank for three cycles and she likes it because of the loans.

Her dream is for her children to become good professionals.

loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Vicente Gonzalo

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Banco Comunal Los Compañeros.

En este lugar vive el señor Vicente, tiene 23 años de edad, está casado y de esta relación tienen una bebe de año y medio de edad. Su esposa es comerciante. Está en el Banco Comunal desde hace 3 ciclos y le gusta porque con los créditos ha podido mejorar aun mas su negocio.

Él  es un joven muy trabajador que hace lo necesario para salir adelante junto con su familia con un trabajo honrado, tiene un bar y cafería en la ciudad, allí trabaja todas las tardes y noches en ocasiones con la ayuda de su esposa y en otras solo ya que ella se dedica a preparar y vender bocadillos y comida para compromisos sociales, algunos de estos bocadillos el también los vende en su local,  lleva dos años con este negocio el cual es el sostén de su familia. 

Este crédito es para comprar bebidas, café y ciertos víveres para preparar los bocadillos que prepara la esposa.
 
Su sueño es seguir aumentando su negocio.
texts.en:
The members of the Los Compañeros communal bank meet every two weeks in the city of Portoviejo, capital of Manabí, known as the city of the royal tamarinds.  Vicente lives here.  He is 23 years old, is married, and has a year and ha half old baby.  His wife is a merchant.  He has been with the communal bank for three cycles and he likes it because the loans have helped him improve his business.

He is a hardworking young man who does what he needs to get ahead with his family, doing honest work.  He has a café in the city, where he works every evening and night.  His wife helps him sometimes and other times he prepares hors d’oeuvres for social occasions.  He also sells these in his cafe.  He’s been doing this for two years and supports his family in this way.

He will use the money from this loan to buy drinks, coffee, and certain food to prepare his hors d’oeuvres.

His dream is to grow his business.

loans.use: to buy supplies and ingredients.

loans.name: Rosana Del Rocio

texts.es:
En  el sector conocido como El Cady en la parroquia Colon  de la ciudad de Portoviejo, se reúnen  cada quince días las socias  del Banco Comunal La Cantera, en esta localidad la mayoría de las personas se dedican a la agricultura.

En este lugar vive la señora Rosana, tiene 35 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene 3 hijos de 17, 10 y 6 años de edad, todos  estudian el mayor en universidad y los menores en escuela. Su esposo trabaja en un bar.

Doña Rosana es una mujer muy trabajadora que siempre le gusto trabajar para ayudar a sus esposo a salir adelante y para darles una muy buena educación a sus hijos, ella hace varios años empezó un negocio de venta de comidas, primero empezó en su casa con algo muy pequeño pero  en la actualidad consiguió un local más grande el cual arrienda y que está ubicado en una vía de acceso hacia la capital manabita en el cual vende mucho mas, allí prepara desayunos, almuerzos y meriendas y en menú variado para deleite de sus clientes que a diario asisten a su local,  trabaja con la ayuda de una señora a quien le paga un sueldo mensual por su trabajo, es así como ella contribuye con los gastos de su hogar y  sacar adelante a su familia.

Este crédito lo va utilizar en comprar arroz, pollos, carne, pescado y otros víveres para la preparación de los alimentos. Está en el Banco Comunal desde el inicio, es la secretaria del grupo y le gusta porque los créditos son rápidos y de mucha ayuda. 

Su meta es tener un local propio.
texts.en:
The members of the La Cantera communal bank meet every two weeks in the area known as El Cady in the city of Portoviejo.  Most of the people here are farmers.

Rosana is 35 years old, is in a common law marriage, and has three children, ages 17, 10, and 6.  All attend school and the oldest studies at university.  Her husband works at a bar.

Rosana is a hardworking woman who always liked working in order to help out her husband to get ahead and provide her children with a good education.  She started her business several years ago and sells food.  She started out working from her home in a small area, but now has her own larger location which she rents and is located in a well-travelled area near the capital, Manabita.  She sells a lot there and prepares breakfasts, lunches, and dinners on a varied menu for her customers who visit her daily.  She works with a lady to whom she pays a monthly salary for her work.  This is how she contributes to the household expenses and gets her family ahead.

She will use the money from this loan to buy rice, chicken, meat, fish and other foodstuffs to prepare her dishes.  She has been in the communal bank from the beginning and she is the group’s secretary.  She likes it because of the loans.

Her goal is to have her own place to sell from.

loans.use: to buy ingredients.

loans.name: María Lucila

texts.es:
En  el sector conocido como El Cady en la parroquia Colon  de la ciudad de Portoviejo, se reúnen  cada quince días las socias  del Banco Comunal La Cantera, en esta localidad la mayoría de las personas se dedican a la agricultura.

En este lugar vive la señora María, tiene 28 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene una hija de 9 años de edad que  estudia en escuela. Su esposo trabaja ocasionalmente no tiene trabajo fijo.

Doña María al ver que su esposo no tiene trabajo y que en ocasiones no tiene ni para llevar la comida a su hogar se dedica al comercio, vende productos de Esika y Sayson (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Realiza esta labor en sus ratos libres y fines de semana ya que de lunes a sábado trabaja en una casa realizando quehaceres domésticos por lo cual recibe un sueldo mensual, ella se sacrifica por el bienestar de su familia ya que para ella es lo más importante, deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada ocho días. Tiene un año que se dedica a esta actividad y gracias a Dios si le deja ganancias las cuales emplea en los estudios de su hija.

Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, cremas y cosméticos. Esta desde el inicio en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque los créditos le sirven de mucha ayuda.
 
Su sueño es darles lo mejor a su hija.
texts.en:
The members of the La Cantera communal bank meet every two weeks in the area known as El Cady in the city of Portoviejo.  Most of the people here are farmers.

Maria lives here. She is 28 years old, is in a common law marriage and has a nine year old daughter who attends school.  Her husband does not have a steady job.

Maria decided to sell Esika and Sayson brand products (beauty products for women, cosmetics, perfume, and accessories) when she saw that her husband was not able to work on occasion and had trouble feeding the family.  She sells in her spare time and on the weekends and works as a housekeeper Monday through Friday, for which she receives a monthly salary.  She sacrifices herself for her family’s wellbeing, which is the most important thing for her.  She sells on credit and collects every week.  She has been doing this for a year and, thanks to God, she earns an income and uses it toward her children’s education.

She will use the money from this loan to buy perfumes, creams, and cosmetics.  She has been with the communal bank from the beginning and likes it because the loans are very helpful.

Her dream is to provide her daughter with the best.

loans.use: to buy inventory

loans.name: Floricenda Del Rocio

texts.es:
En  el sector conocido como El Cady en la parroquia Colon  de la ciudad de Portoviejo, se reúnen  cada quince días las socias  del Banco Comunal La Cantera, en esta localidad la mayoría de las personas se dedican a la agricultura.

En este lugar vive la señora Floricenda, tiene 44  años de edad, está casada y fruto de esta relación tiene tres hijos, dos mayores de edad y uno de 17 años, dos de ellos aun viven con ellos y estudian en universidad y colegio. Su esposo es empleado privado.

Doña Flerida es una mujer que le gusta valerse por sus propios medios y con el fruto de su trabajo poder ayudar a sus hijos con los gastos que generan sus estudios, ella se dedica a la venta de productos de Yanbal y Esika (perfumes, cremas, maquillajes y accesorios de damas y caballeros), su forma de venta es puerta a puerta y también vende en su casa a sus conocidos más cercanos, deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada ocho días,  lleva más de dos años con este negocio.

Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, cremas, accesorios para damas. Esta desde el inicio en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por la ayuda que les ha dado el Banco desde que está en el.
 
Su sueño es ver que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
The members of the La Cantera communal bank meet every two weeks in the area known as El Cady in the city of Portoviejo.  Most of the people here are farmers.

Floricenda lives here.  She is 44 year old, married, and has three adult children and one 17 year old.  Two of them still live at home and study at university.  Her husband is a private employee.

“Flerida” is a woman who likes to value herself through her own means and be able to help her children with their school expenses through her work.  She sells Yanbal and Esika brand products (beauty products for men and women, cosmetics, perfume, and accessories).  She sells door to door and also out of her home to her closest friends and neighbors.  She sells for credit and collects every week and has been doing this for two years.

She will use the money from this loan to buy perfumes, creams, and women’s accessories.  She has been part of the communal bank since the beginning and she likes it because of the help they have provided.  Her dream is to see her children become professionals.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics.

loans.name: Rosa María

texts.es:
En  el sector conocido como El Cady en la parroquia Colon  de la ciudad de Portoviejo, se reúnen  cada quince días las socias  del Banco Comunal La Cantera, en esta localidad la mayoría de las personas se dedican a la agricultura.

En este lugar vive la señora Rosa, tiene 54 años de edad, está casada y fruto de esta relación tiene siete hijos todos mayores de edad e independientes, solo el menor aun vive en su casa. Su esposo es agricultor.

Doña Rosa es una mujer muy luchadora que le encanta valerse por sí misma y con el esfuerzo de su trabajo poder ayudar a su marido que no gana mucho en sus faenas en el campo, ella se dedica a preparar bollos los m ismos que una vez que los prepara su esposo lleva a entregar a diferentes ciudades como Manta y Portoviejo aunque también vende en su casa lugar hasta el cual llegan muchas personas a servirse de este delicioso plato muy típico de nuestra provincia y que es de mucho agrados de sus clientes, omprargracias a esto su familia ha podido salir adelante ya que hay ocasiones que su marido no tiene trabajo y así no puede llevar los alimentos al hogar.

Este crédito es para comprar maní ya que en la época de invierno escasea y se pone muy caro. Este es su segundo ciclo en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque los créditos le ayudan mucho en su negocio.
 
Sus sueños son seguir adelante y que su familia tenga buena salud.
texts.en:
The members of the La Cantera communal bank meet every two weeks in the area known as El Cady in the city of Portoviejo.  Most of the people here are farmers.

Rosa lives here.  She is 54 years old, married, and has seven adult children on their own.  Only the youngest one still lives at home.  Her husband is a farmer.  

Rosa is a woman who puts forth great effort and loves to value herself by the effort she puts into her work to help her husband, who does not earn much through his field tasks.  She makes “bollo” that her husband delivers to different cities like Manta and Portoviejo.  She also sells out of her home, where many people go to sample this delicious, and very typical dish in our province.  This has helped her family get ahead, as there are times when her husband doesn’t have work and can’t feed the family.

She will use the money from this loan to buy “mani,” now that the winter is coming and it gets expensive.  This will be her second cycle with the communal bank and she likes the loans that help her very much in her business.  Her dreams are to get ahead and that her family remains in good health.

loans.use: to buy ingredients.

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es:
En  el sector conocido como El Cady en la parroquia Colon  de la ciudad de Portoviejo, se reúnen  cada quince días las socias  del Banco Comunal La Cantera, en esta localidad la mayoría de las personas se dedican a la agricultura.

En este lugar vive el señor Juan, tiene 25 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre hace muy poco y aun no tiene hijos. Su mujer es ama de casa.

Él  se gana la vida trabajando como albañil, pero no siempre hay trabajo y en ocasiones a estado hasta un mes sin trabajo razón por lo cual decidió también dedicarse al comercio, con el crédito anterior que recibió del banco empezó con un negocio de venta de ropa de todo tipo, esto lo realiza puerta a puerta cuando está desocupado de su otro trabajo, trabaja todos los días o si no los fines de semana ya que aprovecha para ir a otras ciudades a ofrecer sus productos los mismos que deja a crédito, gracias a esto cuando no tiene trabajo puede llevar el pan a su hogar.

Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar más mercadería como: pantalones, blusas, camisetas y ropa de niños. Está en el Banco Comunal desde hace tres ciclos  y le gusta porque gracias al crédito anterior empezó su negocio. 

Su meta es seguir aumentando su negocio.
texts.en:
In the area known as El Cady, in the Colon parish in the city of Portoviejo, the members of the La Cantera communal bank meet every fifteen days. In this locality, the majority of the people work in agriculture.

In this place lives Juan. He is 25 years old and has a very recent common-law marriage, and has no children yet. His partner is a homemaker.

He earns his living working as a mason, but there is not always work, and on occasion he has been without work for a month. Because of this, he decided to also work as a storekeeper. With the previous loan that he received from the bank, he started a business selling all types of clothing. He does this door-to-door when he is not busy from his other work. He works every day, or if not, on the weekends, as he takes the opportunity to go to other cities to offer the same products. Thanks to this, when he doesn’t have work, he is able to bring bread to his home. 

He is going to use this loan to purchase more merchandise, such as: pants, blouses, t-shirts, and children’s clothing. He has been in the communal bank for three loan cycles, and he likes it, because thanks to the previous loan, he began his business. 
  
His goal is to continue expanding his business.

loans.use: to purchase pants, blouses, t-shirts, and children’s clothing.

loans.name: Lucia Margarita

texts.es:
En  el sector conocido como El Cady en la parroquia Colon  de la ciudad de Portoviejo, se reúnen  cada quince días las socias  del Banco Comunal La Cantera, en esta localidad la mayoría de las personas se dedican a la agricultura.

En este lugar vive la señora Lucia, tiene 38 años de edad, está casada pero aun no tiene hijos. Su esposo es maestro constructor.

Doña Lucia es una mujer muy luchadora que al ver que a su esposo en ocasiones no tiene trabajo ni como llevar el pan diario a su hogar decidió hace 11 años empezar con un negocio en su casa, ella con lo que tenia surtió una pequeña tienda de víveres la misma que con el paso del tiempo ha ido surtiendo poco a poco hasta tenerla como lo tiene en la actualidad, en su local sus clientes encuentran de todo desde víveres hasta productos de bazar y papelería y también hace recargas telefónicas, ella está muy feliz ya que así ella contribuye con gran parte en los gastos del hogar.

Este crédito es para comprar víveres, productos de bazar y recargas telefónicas. Lleva 4 ciclos en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque con los créditos se le hace más fácil financiar su negocio.
 
Su sueño es algún día tener un bebé.
texts.en:
In the area known as El Cady in the Colon district of the city of Portoviejo, the members of the "La Cantera" communal bank meet every two weeks. In this area, most people work in agriculture.

Lucia lives in El Cady. She is 38 years old and married, but does not have children yet. Her husband is a general contractor. 

Lucia is a very determined woman who, after seeing her husband out of work at times with no way to earn money, decided to start a business in their house 11 years ago.
