The Communal Bank “San Esteban” meets every 15 days in the city of Charapoto. This city is known for its traditional culture and it is also located a few minutes away from two of the best beaches in the province, San Jacinto and San Clemente.

Sra. Carmen lives in this place. She is 37 years old, married, and has three children (ages 18, 15, and 10). Her oldest child is studying at the university and the two younger ones are in school. Her husband owns a bakery.

Doña Carmen is able to help her family move forward by working as a merchant. She has a store in her house where she sells all types of products such as rice, sugar, oil, detergents, legumes, vegetables, and fruits. In the same location, she and her husband have a bakery where they make bread of different flavors. They also prepare delicious cakes. Carmen and her husband begin working at 5:00 A.M. by baking the bread so that it will be ready when their customers arrive since they always purchase it to bring to their homes. This family business has been in existence for more than 18 years.

This loan will be used to buy more inventory for Carmen’s store such as rice, sugar, oil, and other grocery items, as well as flour, eggs, and shortening for making bread. Carmen has been with the Communal Bank for 13 years and enjoys the assistance she has received through the loans.

Her goals are to continue moving forward and to provide the best for her family.

loans.use: to buy flour, eggs, and shortening for making bread as well as rice, sugar, oil, and other grocery items to sell in her store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cattle to fatten

loans.name: Martha Mercedes

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Virgen Del Mar se reúne cada 15 días en el hermoso balneario de San Mateo en la ciudad de  Manta, conocido por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año por turistas nacionales y extranjeros, en  este lugar la mayoría de los habitantes se dedica a la pesca y a las faenas del mar.

En este lugar vive la señora Martha, tiene 38  años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen cuatro hijos de 15, 12, 9 y 8 años de edad, los  mayores estudian en colegio y las  menores en escuela. Su esposo se dedica a la pesca.

Doña Martha desde hace tres años y con ayuda del primer crédito que recibió del banco empezó con su negocio, ella adecuo un local en su casa para surtir una pequeña  tienda que con el paso del tiempo y con la ayuda de los créditos le ha ido mejorando poco a poco, trabaja todos los días con la ayuda de sus hijos y de su esposo cuando pueden desde las 6h00 hasta las 20h00 y a veces hasta más tarde. Ella le ha puesto muchas ganas y amor a su tienda la cual le permite salir adelante junto a su familia.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en surtir mas su tienda, va a comprar arroz, azúcar, aceite, detergentes y otros víveres. Lleva tres años en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque gracias a los créditos tiene su negocio. 

Su sueño es tener la mejor tienda de la localidad.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Virgen del Mar” meets every 15 days at the beautiful seaside resort of San Mateo in the city of Manta. This city is known for its beautiful beaches that are frequented throughout the year by local and foreign tourists. Most of the residents work in the fishing industry or have jobs that are related to the sea.

Sra. Martha lives in this place. She is 38 years old, married, and has four children (ages 15, 12, 9, and 8). The older children are in high school and the younger ones attend elementary school. Her husband is a fisherman.

Three years ago, Doña Martha used the first loan she received from the Communal Bank to start her own business. She renovated a space in her house for opening a small store. As time passed and with the help of the loans, her business has gradually improved. Martha works every day with the help of her children and her husband whenever they are able. Her business is open from 6:00 A.M. to 8:00 P.M. and sometimes even later. She has invested much effort and love into her store, which has helped her and her family to get ahead.

This loan will be used to buy more inventory for her store such as rice, sugar, oil, detergents, and other grocery items. Martha has been with the Communal Bank for three years and enjoys being a member because the loans have helped her to have a business.

Her dream is to have the best store in town.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, oil, detergents, and other grocery items.

loans.name: Maritza Fiorella

texts.en:
A native of Nazca, Peru, Maritza is a very hard-working young woman. She completed her primary education in Peru, and then began working. She currently works 11 hours a day in a restaurant as she tries to make ends meet. In addition to her work, she is responsible and attentive to her customers.

She began working in the restaurant out of necessity, but now she has a desire to start her own business. She would like to test her entrepreneurial skills by selling clothes and Christmas toys to her neighbors and work colleagues. If she feels confident in her abilities as a business woman and salesperson, she would like to start a business.

Maritza dreams of having a better life, and is willing to put in the hours to get there. She thanks her Kiva lenders for giving her a chance to give herself a better life.

loans.use: to sell clothes and Christmas toys to her neighbors and work colleagues.

loans.name: Johana Elizabeth

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Virgen Del Mar se reúne cada 15 días en el hermoso balneario de San Mateo en la ciudad de  Manta, conocido por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año por turistas nacionales y extranjeros, en  este lugar la mayoría de los habitantes se dedica a la pesca y a las faenas del mar.

En este lugar vive la señora Johana, tiene 31 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos de 10, 8 y 3 años de edad, los mayores estudian en  escuela. Su esposo chofer y comerciante.

Doña Johana para ganar algo por su cuenta y con esto ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo, su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta. También su esposo trae materiales de pesca para vender a comerciantes de este lugar o directamente a pescadores de la zona.  Tanto ella como su esposo trabajan todos los días el con sus transportes y venta de materiales de pesca y ella con la venta de ropa, ella deja a crédito a sus clientes y cobra los fines de semana. Lleva tres años en esta actividad y le va muy bien.

Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar más mercadería como: pantalones, blusas, camisetas y materiales para la pesca. Está en el Banco Comunal desde hace 2 años y le gusta por la ayuda que recibe con los créditos.
 
Su sueño es tener un carro para realizar sus ventas.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Virgen del Mar” meets every 15 days at the beautiful seaside resort of San Mateo in the city of Manta. This city is known for its beautiful beaches that are frequented throughout the year by local and foreign tourists. Most of the residents work in the fishing industry or have jobs that are related to the sea.

Sra. Johana lives in this place. She is 31 years old, married, and has three children (ages 10, 8, and 3). The older children attend school. Her husband works as a chauffeur and a merchant.

Doña Johana earns some money on her own so that she can help her husband with the household expenses. She sells clothing of all types by going door-to-door. Her husband also brings in fishing supplies that are sold either to local merchants or directly to the fishermen in the area. Both Johana and her husband work every day whether it be providing transportation, selling fishing supplies, or selling clothes. She extends credit to her customers and collects payment on the weekends. Johana has been in this business for three years and is doing very well.

The loan she will receive will be used to buy more merchandise such as trousers, blouses, and T-shirts, as well as fishing supplies. She has been with the Communal Bank for two years and enjoys the assistance she has received through the loans.

Her dream is to have a car that she can use for making sales.

loans.use: to buy trousers, blouses, and T-shirts to sell as well as fishing supplies for her husband's business.

loans.name: Paola Katherine

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Virgen Del Mar se reúne cada 15 días en el hermoso balneario de San Mateo en la ciudad de  Manta, conocido por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año por turistas nacionales y extranjeros, en  este lugar la mayoría de los habitantes se dedica a la pesca y a las faenas del mar.

En este lugar vive la señora Paola, tiene 29 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen dos hijos de 6 y de 2 años  de edad, el mayor esta en primero de básica. Su esposo se dedica a la pesca.

Doña Paola es un ama de casa que para obtener sus propios recursos se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo y productos de Yanbal (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas), su forma de venta es puerta a puerta y trabaja tres días a la semana. Ella lleva cinco años dedicada a este negocio. Ella también utiliza el crédito para comprar material de pesca como redes, arpones, combustible y otros materiales para que su esposo la utilice ya que él tiene una pequeña embarcación en la que todos los días se dedica a estas faenas de pesca. Lleva más de 5 años con su negocio.

Este crédito es para comprar ropa de todo tipo, perfumes, cremas, cosméticos y materiales de pesca. Lleva 5 años en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por los bajos intereses que le cobran por los créditos.

Su sueño es tener otra lancha para su esposo ya que la que tienen es muy pequeña.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Virgen del Mar” meets every 15 days at the beautiful seaside resort of San Mateo in the city of Manta. This city is known for its beautiful beaches that are frequented throughout the year by local and foreign tourists. Most of the residents work in the fishing industry or have jobs that are related to the sea.

Sra. Paola lives in this place. She is 29 years old, married, and has two children (ages 6 and 2). The older child is in first grade. Her husband is a fisherman.

Doña Paola is a homemaker who earns additional income by selling clothing of types and Yanbal products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes, and women’s accessories). She conducts her sales by going door-to-door three times a week. Paola has been in this business for five years. She will also use her loan to buy fishing supplies such as nets, harpoons, fuel, and other supplies that her husband needs. He has a small fishing boat that he uses every day for his work out on the sea. He has been in this business for more than five years.

This loan will be used to buy clothing of all types, perfumes, crèmes, cosmetics, and fishing supplies. Paola has been with the Communal Bank for five years and enjoys the low interest rates that are charged on the loans.

Her dream is to acquire another fishing boat since the one her husband currently has is very small.

loans.use: to buy clothing of all types, perfumes, crèmes, cosmetics, and fishing supplies.

loans.name: Rosa Marina

texts.es: Rosa se encarga de elaborar y comercializar pupusas de diferentes tipos como pupusas de queso, chicharrón y frijol con queso. Ella  vive junto a su familia, la cual está conformada por su esposo y dos hijos y el negocio está ubicado en un pupusodromo muy visitado por las personas, en donde existe gran competencia. Por el exquisito sabor que poseen las pupusas que Rosa elabora, cuenta con muchos clientes en el lugar, quienes diariamente y sobre todo los fines de semana consumen sus productos. Ella solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda obtener el capital necesario para comprar mayor cantidad de maíz, queso, chicharrón, frijoles y otros ingredientes más los cuales son fundamentales para hacer las pupusas. Tanto para Rosa como para su familia es de mucha importancia el aumentar sus ventas y brindarle el apoyo necesario a su esposo para sostener entre los dos su hogar y sus hijos quienes se merecen lo mejor.
texts.en:
Rosa makes and sells different types of pupusa such as cheese, crackling, and bean and cheese.  She lives with her family, made up of her husband and her two children.  Her business is located in a pupusa market that's patronized by a lot of people and where competition is fierce.  Rosa has a lot of customers there who eat her food every day, especially on the weekend, because of the delicious flavor of her pupusas.

She's requesting a loan to have the necessary capital to buy large quantities of corn, cheese, cracklings, beans, and other ingredients that are necessary to make the pupusas.

It's important for both Rosa and her family to increase her sales and give her husband the support he needs so that between them they can support their household and their children, who deserve the best.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to make pupusas

loans.name: Deysi Francisca

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Virgen Del Mar se reúne cada 15 días en el hermoso balneario de San Mateo en la ciudad de  Manta, conocido por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año por turistas nacionales y extranjeros, en  este lugar la mayoría de los habitantes se dedica a la pesca y a las faenas del mar.

En este lugar vive la señora Daysi, tiene 36 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen dos hijos de 18 y 6 años de edad, el menor estudia en una  escuela de la localidad. Su esposo se dedica a la pesca.

Doña Deysi es una muy buena ama de casa que para obtener sus propios recursos y con esto poder ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar se dedica a la venta de sandalias, carteras y productos de Yanbal (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Trabaja tres días a la semana de dos a tres horas  diarias, ella deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada ocho días. Tiene más de 11 años que se dedica a esta actividad por lo cual cuenta con buena clientela.

Este crédito es para comprar sandalias, carteras, perfumes, cremas, cosméticos, entre otros productos. Lleva más de 13 años en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque los pagos son fáciles de hacer.
 
Su sueño es tener una lancha nueva para que su esposo realice sus faenas de pesca.
texts.en:
The communal bank, Virgin of the Sea, gets together every 15 days in the beautiful seaside area of San Mateo in the city of Manta, which is known for  its beautiful beaches that are visited year-round by foreign and local tourists.  Most of the population depends on the fishing industry and jobs of the sea.  It is here that Daysi lives.  She is 36 years old, married, and has two children who are 18 and 6 years old.  The youngest studies at the local elementary school.  Her husband is a fisherman.  

Doña Deysi sells sandals, purses, and Yanbal products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes, and women's accessories) as a way of making an income to help her husband with the household expenses.  She works three days a week for two to three hours per day.  She sells her products on credit and charges every eight days.  She has more than 11 years of experience, and has retained loyal customers.  

This loan is to buy sandals, purses, perfumes, creams, cosmetics, as well as other products.  Doña Deysi has been with the communal bank for more than 13 years, and she likes it because the payments are easy to make.  Her dream is to have a new boat with which her husband can complete his jobs at sea.

loans.use: to buy sandals, purses, perfumes, costmetics, etc.

loans.name: Leticia

texts.en: Leticia, age 52, lives in Gattaran. She runs a piggery business as a source of income. She started this business in 2007, and the business serves as her source of funds for her commodities. Now she needs some funds to buy vital supplies in performing her business. This will allow her to increase sales and get more income. A loan of PHP 15,000 will be a great help in purchase of feed, vitamins and medicine. She hopes to use the said amount to earn a higher income.

loans.use: to purchase feed, vitamins and medicine.

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en: Marilou is a hardworking mother of four who owns a sari-sari (general) store. She has run the store for a period of three years. She started this enterprise to earn a profit for the development of her family's standard of living. Since then, she has aimed for a good life so she built her store. But inadequate capital is the serious factor for the business. Now, Marilou is requesting a loan of PHP 6,000 to buy noodles, oil, salt, vinegar, and bread. In the future, Marilou hopes for an easy living.

loans.use: to buy noodles, oil, salt, vinegar and bread for her business.

loans.name: Nora

texts.en:
Nora, 52, runs a sari-sari (general) store in her village and she has requested a PHP 5,000 loan to buy stocks of groceries such as shampoo, oil, canned goods and vinegar to sell in her store.

Through the business, she is able to provide for the daily necessities of her family. She believes that with determination and hard work, she will soon earn a better living.

loans.use: to buy stocks of groceries such as shampoo, oil, canned goods and vinegar for her store.

loans.name: Leticia

texts.en:
Leticia who is now 57 years old, mother of four in their adult aged wants to borrow loan of PHP12,000 for the purpose of developing further her retail store business and piggery. With her current revolving fund of PHP15,000 in the store, she is earning only PHP300 net income each week and was used in the maintenance of her other piggery business. Her husband is a farmer and also assist in maintaining the piggery. 

She hopes to increase her sales daily in the store thus asking for loan to buy for more inventories like canned goods, bake breads, noodles, stock of shampoo, coffee, sugar and many more. Proceeds of her incomes from business will be spent in the expansion of her enterprises and improvement of her family general living condition.

loans.use: To buy merchandise like canned goods, bake breads, noodles, shampoo, coffee, sugar and many more.

location.town: Sitio Buduan, San Pablo Cauayan City

loans.name: Emilia

texts.en:
Emilia is married with nine children, all of them already in their adult age. She is happily living with her family in a village somewhere in Cauayan City. To make an income, she operates a vending business selling various vegetables and fruits. To add to her income, she also retails cell phone loads in their community. 
 
She is asking for a loan of PHP 12,000 to buy different kinds of vegetables and fruits like cabbage, eggplant, bananas, tomatoes and more. After 30 years in vending, Emilia now earns PHP 500 gross income daily that she rolls into the business to maintain their everyday living.

Her hope in the future is to further increase her capital and sales to save for emergencies.

loans.use: To buy various vegetables and fruits like cabbage, eggplant, bananas, tomatoes and more.

location.town: Sitio Buduan, San Pablo Cauayan City

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en: Myrna is from the village of Bagnos. She is 57 years old. Myrna is a responsible mother of eight children. She has a strong determination to lift up her family from poverty. Myrna is engaged in a food marketing business. She has a mini-grocery store in the market where she sells a variety of foods. She wants to expand her business. To make that possible, Myrna is requesting a loan of PHP 50,000 to buy vegetable oil, eggs, ginger, onions, garlic, salt and more food to sell. These additional items will help increase her sales and thus boost her profits. In the future, she wants to provide a progressive lifestyle for her family.

loans.use: to buy vegetable oil, eggs, ginger, onions, garlic, salt and more food to sell

loans.name: Merlina

texts.en:
Merlina lives with her family in the village of Victoria. She is 50 years old and is married with two children. 

To make a living, Merlina is engaged in a junk shop business. She usually buys and sells empty bottles, metal, iron and plastic. She has been in this business for twenty years and earns a maximum of PHP 2,000 a day. 

In this business, Merlina needs additional capital. Therefore, she is asking for a loan in the amount of PHP 50,000 to buy more plastic, empty bottles and iron to resell to the traders. 

In this way, she will improve their standard of living and save some money for emergency purposes.

loans.use: to buy more plastic, empty bottles and iron to resell to the traders.

loans.name: Merlita

texts.en:
Hog-raising is the primary source of income for Mrs. Merlita. She is 49 years old and is married with two children. 

Merlita has been in this business for five years. Right now, she is raising two hogs. According to Merlita, she wants to have an additional hog to raise, but she lacks the necessary capital. In this regard, Merlita is asking for a loan in the amount of PHP 15,000 to buy an additional hog to raise and also to buy feed for them. 

Merlita hopes to grow her business and receive a higher income after disposing time.

loans.use: to buy an additional hog to raise and also to buy feed for them.

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en:
Elsie is a hard-working mother who cooks and sells meals and snacks in her village to supplement her husband's income. She is 47 years old and has two school-age children. Together with her husband, they agreed to continue sending their children to school so that they will earn degrees and find good jobs someday. 

Despite financial difficulty, they have the determination to pursue their plans. Elsie aims to improve her small business to generate higher income. Due to insufficient capital, she is asking for an additional loan of PHP 15,000 to buy pork, chicken, fish, vegetables, and seasonings to cook and sell in the village. With this financial assistance, she believes that she will be able to improve the business.

loans.use: to buy pork, chicken, fish, vegetables, and seasonings to cook and sell in the village.

loans.name: Thaem's Group

texts.en:
Thaem is a villager from a rural area located in the Battambang province’s Moung Russey district. She is 47 years old and married with five children, two of whom are dependents and still in school. He and his wife earn a living through farming rice on a 2-hectare area of farmland. Together, they can earn about KHR 27,000 per day from the current business and can save about KHR 10,000 each day for the future needs.
Thaem has been with VisionFund for five loan cycles and completely paid back the past loans which have helped him to relieve his family’s burden and improve their livelihood. Now he is leading his group of three to request another loan of KHR 1,400,000 each. As the leader, he is going use his portion to buy fertilizer and pesticides for his farmland. He hopes to grow his rice healthfully so as to make a better living and keep his children in school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticides for his farmland

loans.name: Let's Group

texts.en:
Let, 32, is married with two children residing in a rural village of the Moung Russey district of Battambang province. To support the family, Let has been farming rice for three years while her husband works as a carpenter in the local area to earn additional income for the family. Together, they can earn about KHR 20,000 per day and can save about KHR 10,000 each day for their future needs.

Let’s group consists of two members who are both female. Let has been with VisionFund for one cycle and completely paid back the past loan and the other member has been with VisionFund for six cycles. Now Let is leading this group to request another loans of KHR 1,000,000 for each member. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to renovate her old house. She hopes this loan will enable her to have a decent house to live in.

loans.use: To renovate her old house

loans.name: Veang's Group

texts.en:
Veang, 62, is married and lives with his wife and six children in a village in the Moung Russey district of Battambang province. Out of his six children, he still has one child to take care of who is still in school. He and his wife are rice farmers. He has been in rice farming on three hectares of farmland for 30 years, earning about 30,000 KHR per day to feed his family but he can manage to save about 10,000 KHR after daily expenses.
 
Veang’s group consists of four members who live in the same village and he has been with VisionFund for four cycles and completely paid back the past loans, which have helped him to relieve his family’s burden and improve their livelihood. Now he is leading his group to apply for a loan. As the leader, he is going to use his portion to buy fertilizer and pesticides for his farmland. He hopes to grow rice healthfully and fruitfully to earn a better living and keep his child in school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticides for his farmland

loans.name: Channy's Group

texts.en:
Channy is 33 years old and married with two children, both of whom are dependent on her and still in school. She and her family live in a village in the Thmor Koul district of Battambang province. To make a living, she and her husband have been selling grocery items in the local area for two years, earning about 5,000 KHR per day to meet the family needs.
  
Channy is just with VisionFund this cycle while the other member has been with VisionFund for seven cycles. Now she is leading her group of two to request a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy more grocery items for selling. She hopes to earn more income for the family to earn a better living and keep her children in school.

loans.use: To buy more grocery items to sell

loans.name: Navy's Group

texts.en:
Navy is the leader of Navy's Group. Living in a rural area located in the Moungkul Borey district, where crop farming is a common way to make a living, Navy, 36, is a married, mother of three children who are still in school. The sources of her family’s income are from farming rice, raising pigs, and selling various kinds of fruits. She and her husband have been in these businesses for five years. 

This is Navy's fifth loan with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund Cambodia. She successfully used past loans to relieve her family’s financial burden and increase its income. Now, she can earn about KHR 30,000 per day save for the future about KHR 10,000 per day. 

With the need to support her business, she formed a group of four (Navy's Group) to request another loan of KHR 1,000,000 each. As the leader, Navy is going to use her portion of the loan to buy more fruits to sell. She hopes to earn more income for her family, so as to make their lives better and to keep her children in school.

loans.use: To buy more fruits to sell.

location.town: Banteay Meanchey Province, Mongkul Borey District

loans.name: Dindo

texts.en:
Dindo is a responsible father and a farmer, living at Estefania with his wife and children. He is raising crops, particularly planting and harvesting corn to sell. He usually gains about PHP 12,000 during each harvest season (twice a year). Aside from managing his cornfield, Dindo also serves his fellows as an active counselor in their village. 

Now, Dindo hopes to achieve more crop production. That is why he is asking for a loan of PHP 40,000 to invest in buying fertilizers and insecticides for use in farming. Dindo would like to keep making the business profitable and save funds for education expenses.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and insecticides for use in farming.

loans.name: Warren

texts.en:
Warren is 32 years old, married, and has two school-aged children. They live happily in a rural community, planting and harvesting rice, vegetables, and raising livestock for sale. Due to the hardship of living, he also uses his motorcycle for public transport to generate additional income. 

Warren aims to improve their poor living conditions in order to educate his children and give them a better life. To strengthen the business, Warren is requesting additional capital of PHP 12,000 to buy gasoline, wheels, and spare parts needed for the maintenance of his motorcycle. He believes that that, someday, he will increase his income and improve his family's status of living through his patience and sacrifices.

loans.use: to buy gasoline, wheels, and spare parts needed for the maintenance of his motorcycle.

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou is asking for a loan of 15,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy groceries like noodles, canned goods, coffee, sugar, creamer, detergent soap, and shampoo. This loan will greatly help Marilou in developing the general store business she has managed for seven years now.

She currently rolls in 4,000 PHP in the store and is earning 300 PHP gross sales each day. Aside from this general store, she is also involved in a bamboo shoot retail business in which she earns only 250 PHP.

Marilou is 36 years old with two school aged children. Her husband is a farmer and they live peacefully in a village somewhere in Cauayan City.

loans.use: to buy grocery items like noodles, canned goods, coffee, sugar, creamer, detergent soap, and shampoo.

location.town: Sitio Buduan, San Pablo Cauayan City

loans.name: Masom

texts.en:
Masom, 53, is married with three dependent children. Her family lives in a house with a thatch roof located in Kampong Cham province’s Dambae district and the main sources of her family’s income are from farming rice on five hectares of farmland and planting cassava and beans in her village. She has been running her business for 6 years, earning about US $12 per day and she is able to save about US $5 each day.

Masom has been with VisionFund for one cycle and completely paid back the past loan, which has helped her to relieve her family’s burden. She is now applying for another loan of US $1,000 to buy fertilizer and pesticides for her plantation business. She hopes to earn a high crop yield from her plantation business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides for her plantation business.

loans.name: Horn's Group

texts.en:
Horn is 52 years old and married with six children. Her family lives in a village of the Sampov Meas district of Pursat province, and she and her husband earn a living through farming rice and planting corn. Having been in this business for almost 26 years, Horn is able to earn about 12,000 KHR per day and manages to save about 6,000 KHR each day after daily expenses. 

Horn has been with VisionFund for two cycles and completely paid back the previous loans, which have helped her to relieve her family’s burden and improve their livelihood. Now she is leading her group of three to ask for a loan. As the leader, Horn is going to use her portion of the loan to pay for labor costs in harvesting rice. She hopes to earn more income so as to make a better living and keep her children in school.

loans.use: to pay for labor costs in harvesting rice.

loans.name: Danilo

texts.en:
Danilo, who grows corn in Amulung, is married to Antonia and has four children. They manage farmland upon which they plant and harvest corn to sell. Usually earning about P20,000 each harvest season, Danilo pays school expenses and house bills.

Now, in order to keep developing his business, Danilo is requesting a loan of P50,000 to buy fertilizers and pesticides for the farm. These purchases will help ensure crop nutrition and a fruitful harvest. The additional revenue generated will be saved for the children's education and the family's future expenses.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides for his farm.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy is a patient mother of two school-age and two infant children. She is married to a farmer, and they live peacefully in a simple village in Cauayan City. She believes in this motto: "Patience is the key to success."

Mercy is requesting a loan of PHP7,000 as added capital for her piggery and vending businesses. With it she will buy hog feed, one pig and various vegetables such as bitter gourds, squash, cabbage, tomatoes and some fruits such as bananas to sell. In business for 10 years now, her income has been a big help in supporting most of their basic needs.

Mercy aspires to the growth of her vending and piggery enterprises to improve her family's general living conditions and to save some money for the future secondary and tertiary education of her children.

loans.use: to buy hog feed, fruits and vegetables.

location.town: Sitio Buduan, San Pablo Cauayan City

loans.name: Chanthou's Group

texts.en:
Chanthou, 28, is married and lives with her family in a village of the Sampov Meas district. She has two daughters to take care of and now they are still too young for school. To make a living, she has been working for others for a fee for several years while her husband complements the income by working as a solder in a local area to better support the family.  The current business earns her family about 17,000 KHR per day to meet the family’s needs.

Chanthou has been with VisionFund for three loan cycles while the other members have been for two loan cycles. Chanthou successfully paid back the past loans which have helped her to better support her business. Now she is leading her group of three to ask for loan of 1,400,000 KHR each. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy a decent motorbike for commuting in her family. She hopes this loan will enable her to have a proper motor to use in her family.

loans.use: to buy a decent motorbike for commuting in her family

loans.name: Marites

texts.en: Due to lack of job opportunities, Marites decided to engage in buying and selling of frozen foods to supplement her husband's income. She is 38 years old and has four school-age children. Due to high cost of school fees and transportation, she needs to increase her income to support the education of her children. She wants them to become professionals in the future. In this regard, Marites aims to improve her business to generate sufficient income. But due to insufficient capital, she is requesting an additional 20,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy more stocks of tocino (sweetened cured pork), ham, longanisa (pork sausage), and hot dogs for sale. Through hard patience and hard work, she believes that she will improve the business and increase her income. In the future, she is hoping that all her children will become professionals.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of tocino, ham, longanisa, and hot dogs for sale.

location.town: Brgy. La Torre South, Bayombong, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Thy

texts.en:
Thy is 48 years old. She is widowed and resides with two children in Prey Veng Province, Cambodia. She has been selling groceries for more than four years, earning approximately $25 daily. One of her children is a garment worker who earns about $4 each day. 

Due to the difficulty in her family’s transportation, Thy is requesting a loan of $1500 to purchase a motorbike for commuting. This purchase will help her reduce transportation expenses. In the future, she would like to expand her store and help her youngest child earn a higher education. She also wants to build a new, bigger house, if possible.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for commuting.

loans.name: Channy

texts.en:
Channy is 37 years old. She is married and resides with two children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She has been running a tailoring shop at home for more than three years, earning approximately $3 daily. 

Her husband runs a public transportation service (tuk tuk). He makes an income of $5 each day. Because the present motorbike is broken, Channy is requesting a loan of $1300 to replace the motorbike. This purchase will help her husband attract more customers and earn more income for the family. 

In addition, a part of this money will be used to purchase more cloth to use for sewing clothes. In the future, Channy would like to expand her shop and help her children earn bachelor’s degrees.

loans.use: to replace the previous motorbike used in her husband's public transportation (tuk tuk) business and buy more cloth for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Nov

texts.en:
Nov is 52 years old, married and he resides with six children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. 

He has been making broom to sell for more than four years, earning approximately $2 daily.  His wife helps him run the business. 

Four of his children are employed. They earn about $12 each day.  

In order to improve his family’s finances, Nov is requesting a loan of $1000 to purchase broom to resell.  By doing so, he would earn additional income for the family.  In the future, he would like to build a new house and help his children earn a higher level of education.

loans.use: to purchase broom to resell.

loans.name: Khenmedekh

texts.en:
Khenmedekh, 35 years old, lives with her husband and two children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. The family resides in their own house on a plot of land. From 2006 to 2010, Khenmedekh sold construction materials and, in 2010, she stopped her construction material business and began selling clothes. Her husband works as a transporter and helps her business. 

Khenmedekh is requesting the loan of 1,000,000 MNT to purchase clothes for inventory turnover. She purchases her goods from China on wholesale price and sells here on retail price. The gap between prices becomes her profit. As a result, the family can expand her business and generate more income thus opening opportunities for investment in their children’s education.

loans.use: to purchase inventory of clothes for resale

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is 46 years old, married, and has children to sustain. They have a farming business and a retail store as sources of income. The couple is very grateful to have these kinds of businesses, necessary to sustain their family's daily consumption. From the farming business, Erlinda usually gains PHP 15,000 in each harvest season (twice a year). 

Erlinda's determination to succeed motivated her to avail herself of a loan to invest in making her crops more productive. She is asking for a loan of PHP 25,000 to buy pesticides and insecticides used in farming. 

In the future, Erlinda would like to keep making her business grow, leading to a progressive life someday.

loans.use: to buy pesticides and insecticides used in farming.

loans.name: Nimfa

texts.en:
Nimfa is 40 years old, married, and has three school-aged children. Due to a lack of job opportunities, she engages in buying and selling footwear in the Public Market. She aims to improve the business, to increase her income and to help her husband in financing the education of their children. Nimfa and her husband want the children to earn degrees, so that they will find good jobs someday. 

For this reason, Nimfa plans to increase her product offerings to satisfy her customers' demands. In this regard, she is asking for additional capital of PHP 25,000 to buy more stocks of sandals, slippers, and shoes to sell. Nimfa mentioned that this loan will help her to improve the business and she hopes that, someday, she will become financially stable.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of sandals, slippers, and shoes to sell.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Alberto

texts.en:
Alberto, a farmer and a hardworking man, peacefully lives in Amulung with his wife and children. The family's viable source of income comes from farming, where they plant and harvest corn to sell. He is an optimistic person and aims to keep harvesting good crops every season. Alberto also pays for laborers who help them in the farming business. And now, he is borrowing a loan of PHP 40,000 to further develop his income. He will buy corn seeds, fertilizer, and pay labor costs in the farming business.

Someday, with a good income, Alberto will achieve financial security, which his family desires too.

loans.use: to buy corn seeds, fertilizer, and pay labor costs in the farming business

loans.name: Irine

texts.en: Due to financial difficulty, Irine runs a small variety store near the Public Market, selling grocery items and vegetables to generate additional income. She is 38 years old, married, and has three school-aged children. Due to high cost of school fees and commodities, she needs to increase her income to satisfy their necessities and continue financing the education of her children. She is asking for additional capital of PHP 8,000 to further improve the business. She intends to spend the loan buying more beverages, seasonings and vegetables to sell. She is hoping that this financial assistance will help her to improve the business to make it more viable and profitable in the future.

loans.use: to buy more beverages, seasonings and vegetables to sell

loans.name: Myrleyn Gay

texts.en:
Myrleyn Gay is aiming to become successful and financially stable in the future. She is 28 years old, married and has two infant-age children. She and her husband help each other in generating income to satisfy their necessities and save some for future emergencies. 

While she takes care of her children, Myrleyn Gay buys and sells charcoal in the local community to generate income. She aimed to acquire more stocks of charcoal to sell, but she has not enough capital; therefore, she is asking for an additional loan of P7,000.00 to buy more stocks of charcoal to sell. She believes that she will be able to improve the business with this financial assistance.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Yan's Group

texts.en:
A resident from a rural village in the Sampov Meas district, Yan is a 62-year-old mother of nine children, one of whom is dependent on her and works as a paid worker in the local area to better support the family. The main source of the family’s income is from rice farming on 1.5-hectare of land, which Yan has been doing for 30 years. With her current business, she can earn about KHR 16,000 per day to spend for daily expenses.

Yan and the other members have been with VisionFund for three cycles. Yan fully paid back the previous loans, which have helped her to better support her family. Now she is leading her group to apply for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizer and pesticides for her farmland. She hopes to grow her rice healthfully and sell it for a good price to make a better living..

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides for her farmland.

loans.name: Tahira

texts.en: Ms Tahira is a 32-year-old married woman and a mother of four children. She is trying hard to fulfil their demands including food, health, clothing and education. She has been stitching gloves for the past eight years. She has one sewing machine which has been purchased with the financial help of Kashf Foundation. Her husband is working on a power loom but his income is not sufficient to run the household alone so she is contentedly doing it for the sake of her family and contributes enough to the family income. She has a good client list; however due to a lack of available funds she is unable to meet the daily demand of her customers. Due to this she applied for a loan of 25,000 PKR to buy one more machine with spools of threads to inflate her sales.  She has been associated with Kashf Foundation for two years. She expects a boost in her earnings and wishes to spend part of the profits on the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: to buy one more machine with spools of threads to inflate her sales.

loans.name: Rukhsana

texts.en:
Rukhsana is a 43-year-old married woman and a mother of four. She has been successfully running a small general store in her community for the last 10 years. She offers a variety of goods for daily use. She has good communication skills and has built a good client list. Her husband also helps run her business. Both of them earn money to support the needs of their family members. 

In order to fully stock her store, she needs to purchase items like packs of beverages and stocks of rice and flour. To do this, she contacted the Kashf Foundation and requested a loan of 25,000 PKR. The loan will help her to consistently meet the increased demand at her store.

loans.use: to purchase packs of beverages and stocks of rice and flour to sell

loans.name: Sawara

texts.en: Sawara is a 20-year-old young lady who has been running a beauty parlor in the corner of her home for three years. She has become famous on her street for providing high quality service to her customers. She makes enough money to contribute to the family income. In order to serve more customers at a time, she needs to purchase more beauty products, packs of hair dye, and tools such as a hair dryer and a hair straightener. To finance these purchases, she requested a loan of 20,000 PKR from Kashf Foundation. She wishes to cater to more customers during the upcoming Christmas season. She hopes to expand her business in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase more beauty products, packs of hair dye, and tools such as a hair dryer and a hair straightener

loans.name: Sayeda

texts.en:
Sayeda is a 34-year-old, married woman and a mother of five. She has been successfully running a stitching business for the past year. 

Her husband is an auto rickshaw driver, but due to the unavailability of CNG (compressed natural gas used to power the auto), he is not able to earn a sufficient amount of income on a daily basis. This compelled Sayeda to work to support her family for a better future. She already had a stitching machine which she got in her dowry. She started stitching clothes for the people living around her house and she uses the income to support her entire family. However, due to low funds, she was facing difficulty and was unable to meet the daily demands of her customers, so she contacted Kashf Foundation.  

Sayeda is currently in her second loan cycle and has requested PKR 30000. She intends to use this loan amount to buy raw materials, such as spools of threads in different colors, packs of laces, buttons, and zippers, etc., to create a means of increasing revenues, so she may be able to generate a healthier source of income. Sayeda wishes to utilize a portion of the profit to create a better future for her children.

loans.use: to buy raw materials, such as spools of threads in different colors, packs of laces, buttons, and zippers etc., for her stitching business.

loans.name: Tine

texts.en:
Tine is forty-two years old and lives in northeast Albania. She is married and has four school-aged children: 17, 14, 10 and 8 years old.

Tine’s activity for the past fourteen some years has been in livestock. Even though her husband has been helping her in this activity, she is the one who operates it. She sells milk and baby animals to the locals. “Despite complaints about the economy going down, for some reason, my earning income from this activity hasn’t changed for the worse. And I am glad about it,” she said.

Tine is in need now of a loan of approximately USD 1400 to buy another milk cow to expand her activity. This would be her first one.

loans.use: To add another milk cow

loans.name: Bushra

texts.en: Ms. Bushra is a 36 year-old married woman and a mother of six. She has been stitching clothes for many years. She believes in contributing to the family income as it’s her duty to provide good food, shelter and education to her children. She is a master in her work of stitching and has retained many regular customers. In order to complete orders on time she applied a loan of Rs. 20000 to purchase a new electronic sewing machine with more spools of threads. She has been in association with Kashf for two years and has shown excellent repayment behavior. She wishes to utilize her earned revenue for the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: to purchase a new electronic sewing machine with more spools of threads.

loans.name: Liljana

texts.en:
Liljana is 45 years old and is married with three children -  two of them are attending school. They live in a rural region in northern Albania. 

Seven years ago, Liljana started a viticulture business. At the time, she was not sure what to expect. Yet, years later, she is happy with the progress and the income she earns from it considering that she is the only person supporting her family financially. “This is a seasonal business and probably there is some pressure during those busy months, but after that, you are just free to do other things should you wish to,” Liljana said.

Liljana sells grapes to the stores and makes wine that she sells to the locals. She is requesting a loan of 90,000 Albanian Lek to do some work on her vineyards.

loans.use: to do some work on her vineyards.

loans.name: Zoje

texts.en:
Zoje is 60 years old and is married, yet she doesn’t have any children. She lives in northern Albania. The village where she has been residing for a long time now gets slammed by lots of rains almost every year. Despite the flooding, she manages to keep milk cows. From the milk the cows produce, she makes delicious and good quality butter, cheese, and cottage cheese that she sells to the locals.

Throughout the past 10 years she has been enjoying a steady growth that makes her happy.

Zoje wants to add another dairy cow this time and is applying for a loan from Kiva through VisionFund Albania. The amount she is requesting is 150,000 Albanian Lek and she hopes that she will be getting this amount from lenders. This will be her third loan. Her other loans have been paid in full.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Buenas Emprendedoras - 26 Group

texts.es: El Banco de Emprendimiento BUENAS EMPRENDEDORAS – 26 está compuesta por nueve integrantes de los cuales siete  son mujeres y dos varones que se dedican a distintas actividades, la presidenta del banco es la  Sra. Emma,  tiene 47 años casada,  se dedica a la confección y costura de prendas de vestir  de manera artesanal, tiene su taller en la zona de Pasankeri, este préstamo es su primera secuencia  dentro de la institución la  Sra. Emma va a utilizar este préstamo para la  compra de tela, hilo y otros para su negocio su razón para solicitar este préstamo es la falta de efectivo ya que esto no les permite crecer en su negocio y esto es un reto  en su negocio ya  que en estas fechas se incrementa su demanda y tiene que trabajar mas para generas mas ingresos va a utilizar los beneficios en seguir comprando material e insumos para su negocio que crezcan y así poder tener mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Buenas Emprendedoras--26 Communal Bank is made up of nine members, six women and two men who make a living in different jobs.  The president of the bank is Emma, 47.  She earns a living in dressmaking and sewing garments by hand.  Her shop is in the Pasankeri area.

This loan is Emma's first sequence with the institution.  She's going to use it to buy fabric, thread, and other supplies for her business.  She's requesting the loan because she lacks the cash she needs to grow in her business.

This is a challenge in her business because demand rises during this season and she has to work more to earn more income.  She's going to use the profits to continue buying materials and supplies for her business, so it will grow.  This way she'll have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy fabric wholesale

loans.name: Celeste - 26 Group

texts.es: El Banco de Emprendimiento CELESTE – 26 está compuesta por once integrantes de los cuales diez  son mujeres y un varón que se dedican a distintas actividades, la presidenta del banco es la Sra. Maria tiene 53 años,  se dedica  a la   venta de variedad de productos ya sea joyas y ropa,  ella vende sus productos de manera ambulante, visitando domicilios y oficinas públicas y privadas de la ciudad de La Paz,  donde ofrece sus productos,  este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra. Maria va a utilizar este préstamo para la compra de joyas y ropa por mayor ya que esta época tiene mucha demanda y de esta manera brindar variedad de productos a su clientela e incrementar sus ganancias,  su razón para solicitar este préstamo es seguir mejorando en su  negocio, la Sra. Maria va a utilizar los beneficios para seguir comprando variedad de productos, la Sra. Maria es una persona muy trabajadora se siente feliz por la oportunidad brindada ya que esta es su única actividad que le permite mantener a su familia.
texts.en:
The communal bank CELESTE - 26 is made up of eleven members, ten women and one man.  They make a living in different activities.  The president of the bank is Maria.  She is fifty-three years old and makes a living selling various products, like jewelry and clothing.  She sells her items by going door to door, visiting homes and public and private offices in the city of La Paz where they offer her products.  

This loan is her first within the institution.  Maria is going to use this loan to buy jewelry and clothing wholesale, since at this time of year, there is a lot of demand.  In this way, she will be able to offer a variety of products to her customers and increase her income.  Her reason for requesting a loan is to continue improving her business.  Maria is going to use the profits to continue buying a variety of products.  

Maria is a hard-working individual and feels happy for the loan opportunity offered to her, since her work is the only activity that allows her to maintain her family.

loans.use: to buy jewelry, clothing, and other merchandise wholesale.

loans.name: Calle-48 Chasquipampa Group

texts.es: E El Banco de Emprendimiento CALLE-48 CHASQUIPAMPA está compuesta por nueve integrantes todas son  mujeres que se dedican a distintas actividades, la presidenta del banco es la Sra. Lizeth tiene 24 años,  ella trabaja en un restauran prestando sus servicios de mesera,  este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra. Lizeth va a utilizar este préstamo para la compra de muebles para su casa ya que tiene un dinerito ahorrado y mas el crédito podrá tener una parte de su casa amoblada y así tener una mayor comodidad, la Sra. Lizeth es una persona muy trabajadora se siente feliz por la oportunidad brindada.
texts.en: The communal Bank CALLE-48 CHASQUIPAMPA comprises 9 members, all female, who run different businesses. The president of the group is Lizeth, who is 24 years old. She works in a restaurant as a server. This is her 1st loan with the communal bank. With the loan and the little bit of money she has saved, she will be able to buy furniture and make her home more comfortable. Lizeth is a hard-working person and is happy to have been given this opportunity.

loans.use: buy furniture.

loans.name: Paz Y Progreso - 26 Group

texts.es: El Banco de Emprendimiento PAZ Y PROGRESO – 26 está compuesta por nueve integrantes de los cuales ocho son mujeres y un varón que se dedican a distintas actividades, la presidenta del banco es la  Sra. Jenny,  tiene 31 años y un hijito de la edad de 4 añitos,  se dedica a la venta de flores en su puesto de venta que se encuentra ubicado por la zona del tejar, ella es cliente antigua de la institución,  la  Sra. Jenny va a utilizar este préstamo para la  compra de flores al por mayor  para su negocio ya que realiza distintos arreglos florares y esta época de fin de año tiene mucha demanda por la gran cantidad de matrimonios que existen, su razón para solicitar este préstamo es la falta de efectivo y va a utilizar los beneficios en seguir comprando material e insumos para su negocio que crezcan y así poder tener mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
PAZ Y PROGRESO (Peace and Progress) – 26 is composed of nine members, of whom eight are women. They are engaged in various activities. The group president is Jenny. She is 31 years old and has a 4 year old son. She is dedicated to the sale of flowers at her trading post located in the tejar zone. She is an old client of the institution.

Jenny will use this loan to purchase wholesale flowers for her business that makes different flower arrangements and this time of year there is a high demand die to the large quantity of marriages that happen. 

The reason she is requesting this loan is her lack of cash. She will use the profits to continue buying material and supplies for her business to grow and to be able to have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy wholesale flowers.

loans.name: Sol De Vino Tinto - 26 Group

texts.es: El Banco de Emprendimiento SOL DE VINO TINTO – 26 está compuesta por ocho integrantes de los cuales seis son mujeres y dos  varónes que se dedican a distintas actividades, la presidenta del banco es la Sra. Lourdes tiene 45 años tiene dos hijos que son de las edades de 12 y 7 años, ella se dedica a la venta de jugos naturales, y variedad de refrescos en su puesto de venta que se encuentra en la zona de San Pedro, este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra. Lourdes va a utilizar este préstamo para la compra de refrescos por mayor para surtir su puesto de venta, su razón para solicitar este préstamo la falta de efectivo para la compra de productos, la Sra. Lourdes enfrenta retos en su negocio que la competencia ya que existen muchos puestos de venta de refrescos por  la zona,  va a utilizar los beneficios en tener un capital de inversión, su deseo es de tener un snak donde pueda ofrecer variedad de jugos café y variedad de repostería.
texts.en:
SOL DE VINO TINTO (Sun of Red Wine) – 26 is composed of eight members, six of which are women, two are men. They are engaged in various activities. 

The group president is Lourdes. She is 45 years old and has two children, ages 12 and 7. She is dedicated to the sale of natural juices and a variety of refreshments at her trading post, which is located in the San Pedro area.

This is her first loan with the institution. Lourdes will use the loan to buy wholesale refreshments to sell at her post. Her reason for requesting this loan is her lack of cash to purchase products. Lourdes faces challenges in her business, such as competition, since there are many places selling refreshments in the area.

She will make use of the benefits in having investment capital. Her desire is to have a snack bar where she can offer a variety of juices, coffee, and pastries.

loans.use: to buy wholesale refreshments.

loans.name: Ada Esmeralda

texts.es:
La señora Ada vive en la ciudad de Tegucigalpa, está casada y tiene dos hijos, hace dos años que decidió instalar su negocio de Pulpería, ofrece variedad de productos de consumo diario como arroz, frijoles,  jugos, leches, azúcar, refrescos, gas, leña, lácteos y otros.
Doña Ada tiene su negocio ubicado en su casa de habitación hasta donde llegan sus vecinos a comprarle, su esposo le ayuda con las compras las que realiza dos veces por semana en uno de los mercados de la ciudad y otros productos llegan a entregarlo hasta su negocio, sus hijos le ayudan en la atención a los clientes.
Doña Ada está solicitando el apoyo de Prisma con un préstamo por la cantidad de L. 15,000.00, el cual será utilizado para la compra de productos como ser jabón, quesos, pan, refrescos, galletas, arroz, frijoles, azúcar, leches, aguas, papeles higiénicos, café, salsas y condimentos para surtir la pulpería. 


Tegucigalpa, Honduras -  Noviembre del 2012
texts.en:
Ada lives in the city of Tegucigalpa and is married with two children. Two years ago, she opened a grocery store that offers a variety of staples such as rice, beans, juice, milk products, sugar, sodas, gas, wood, and more. Ada business is located in her house, and neighbors are her customers. Her husband helps her purchase her inventory twice a week at one of the city markets, and her children help her wait on customers. 

Ada is applying to Prisma for a loan of L. 15,000.00 to buy soap, cheeses, bread, sodas, cookies, rice, beans, sugar, milk, water, toilet paper, coffee, sauces, and condiments to stock her business.

Tegucigalpa, Honduras -  November 2012

loans.use: to buy soap, cheeses, bread, sodas, cookies, rice, beans, sugar, milk, water, toilet paper, coffee, sauces, and condiments for her business.

loans.name: Adan

texts.es:
El señor Adán  vive en la ciudad de Tegucigalpa, está casado y tiene dos hijos, hace tres años él y sus hermanos decidieron instalar un negocio de venta de zapatos, sandalias y tenis  usados, mismo que se encuentra ubicado en uno de los mercados de la ciudad.
Don Adán tiene variedad de surtido y precios, realiza sus compras quincenalmente a personas que viajan a los Estados Unidos para traer esta mercadería, debido a que están ubicados en un lugar muy estratégico y la calidad de sus productos es muy buena, su negocio es visitado a diario por muchas personas.
Don Adán solicita el préstamo por la cantidad de L. 15,000.00 lempiras a un plazo de cuatro meses para poder invertir en esta temporada navideña en variedad de estilos de zapatos, sandalia, tenis y botas para ofrecer a sus clientes.
Don Adán su sueño es poder abrir otra tienda de zapatos.


Tegucigalpa, Honduras – Noviembre del 2012
texts.en:
Adán lives in the city of Tegucigalpa. He is married and has two children. Three years ago, he and his brothers decided to begin a new business selling used shoes, sandals and tennis shoes. It is located in one of the city's markets.

Adán has a variety of shoes and prices. He buys their stock every two weeks from people that travel to the United States for their merchandise. Since they have a very strategic location, and the quality of their products is very good, their business is visited daily by many people. 

Adán is requesting a loan of 15,000 Lempiras ($775) for a period of four months to invest in this Christmas season in a variety of styles of shoes, sandals, tennis shoes, and boots to offer their clients.

Adán's dream is to open another shoe store.

Tegucigalpa, Honduras

loans.use: to buy shoes, sandals, tennis shoes and boots for his business

loans.name: Ruben Javier

texts.es: El Sr. Rubén sigue con la actividad de  Coordinador - capacitador su oficina se encuentra en la zona central, cuenta que le fue bien con el anterior credito, que lo utilizo en infraestructura de ambientes de capacitación,  Rubén en esta ocacion solicita el credito para la compra de muebles que faltan para las aulas.
texts.en:
Rubén continues with his activity of being a training coordinator.  His office is located in the central area of the city.  He says that all went well with his previous loan, which he used for the infrastructure of his training rooms.  

This time, Rubén is requesting a loan to buy the furniture that is needed in the classrooms.

loans.use: to buy the needed furniture for the classrooms.

loans.name: Jaime

texts.es:
Jaime is a 25 year old man from Aguaytia, Peru. Aguaytia is in the jungle regions of Peru, and has very striking landscapes. Jaime lives there as a motorcycle and mototaxi  mechanic. He calls his business “J.B.,” his initials. He works 12 hours from Monday to Saturday, and half days on Sundays. 

He services approximately 20 clients per day, and believes he has been able to have such a steady clientele because of the excellent service and responsibility he shows to each and every customer. He has requested a loan in order to purchase materials for his business, including accessories for the vehicles, lubricant, parts, and tires.

In six months, Jaime would like to expand his business to another location in the central zone of Aguaytia. He dreams of being one of the best mechanics in all of Aguaytia.
texts.en:
Jaime is a 25 year old man from Aguaytia, Peru. Aguaytia is in the jungle regions of Peru, and has very striking landscapes. Jaime lives there as a motorcycle and mototaxi mechanic. He calls his business “J.B.,” his initials. He works 12 hours from Monday to Saturday, and half days on Sundays. 

He services approximately 20 clients per day, and believes he has been able to have such a steady clientele because of the excellent service and responsibility he shows to each and every customer. He has requested a loan in order to purchase materials for his business, including accessories for the vehicles, lubricant, parts, and tires.

In six months, Jaime would like to expand his business to another location in the central zone of Aguaytia. He dreams of being one of the best mechanics in all of Aguaytia.

loans.use: to purchase more accessories, lubricants, parts, tires, tubes and other items.

loans.name: Patron De San Jeronimo 5 Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “PATRON DE SAN JERONIMO 5”; Este banco se ubicado en el distrito de San Jerónimo, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es  el señor  Manuel , el socio tiene 48 años de edad,02 hijos y es conviviente; él socio alterna sus actividades diarias brindando el servicio de taxi, el socio lleva años en este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, él socio trabaja de lunes a sabado, a la vez el socio cuenta con un horno donde elabora pan para luego distribuirlo a sus  clientes que le solicitan actividad que realiza conjuntamente con su pareja por las mañanas, el socio es una persona responsable y empeñoso siendo de esta forma que el socio saca adelante a su familia.

El socio solicita el crédito para el mantenimiento de su carro como en el cambio de aceite y en la compra de algunos repuestos que le faltan.

Los otros socios  se dedican al negocio de venta de anticuchos, venta de zapatos, venta de lechon, venta de platería, taxi, maestro constructor, guía de turismo, enfermera.

El socio agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
These people belong to the 'Patron de San Jerónimo 5' community bank which is located in San Jerónimo district, in Cusco province, in Cusco department.

Manuel is 48 years old.  He lives with his partner and has two children.  His business is providing a taxi service.  He has been in this business for years and it is doing very well thanks to the hard work that he puts in every day, working from Monday to Saturday.  In addition, Manuel also has an oven where he bakes bread which he then delivers to customers who request it.  He carries out this business in the mornings, together with his other half.  Manuel is a responsible, diligent person and this is how he provides for his family.

Manuel is requesting a loan so that he can have an oil change carried out on his car and buy some spare parts that it needs.

The other members of this group sell a variety of products including kebabs, shoes, suckling pig and silver jewelry, provide taxi services, work as a master builder, a tourist guide, and a nurse.  Manuel is grateful to the people who will help him to achieve his goals in this way and pledges to make his loan repayments on time.

loans.use: to have an oil change carried out on his car and to buy some spare parts that it needs

loans.name: Domitila

texts.es:
La señora Domitila  vive en la ciudad de Tegucigalpa, está casada y tiene cuatro hijos de los cuales dos viven con ella, tiene 21 años de dedicarse a la elaboración y venta de tortillas,  su actividad comienza desde las 5:00  am hasta las 7:00 pm, todos los días de la semana, cuenta con el apoyo de sus hijos, quienes desde pequeños han trabajado junto con ella, sus hijos también estudian en los colegios públicos de la ciudad.
Doña Domitila la mayoría de sus ventas las realiza a sus vecinos y personas que transitan por su vivienda, está solicitando 20,000.00 lempiras para la compra de cemento, arena, ladrillo y varillas materiales para la construcción de una pared en su vivienda.
Doña Domitila uno de sus sueños es poder terminar la construcción casa y poder ofrecer una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos. 

Tegucigalpa, Honduras - Noviembre del 2012
texts.en:
Domitila lives in the city of Tegucigalpa.  She’s married and has four children two of which still live with her.  She’s been making and selling tortillas for 21 years.  She starts her activity at 5am and goes until 7pm every day of the week.  Her children who have worked alongside her since they were little help her out; they also attend local public schools in the city.

Most of Domitila’s sales are to neighbors and people who pass by her house.  She’s requesting a 20,000 Lempira loan to buy cement, sand, brick and rebar to build a wall at home.  One of Domitila’s dreams is to finish building her house to provide better quality of life for her children.

Tegucigalpa, Honduras - November, 2012.

loans.use: to buy building materials and supplies.

loans.name: Felix Cantalicia

texts.es:
La señora Félix  vive en la ciudad de Tegucigalpa, vive con su esposo y sus tres hijos, quienes están estudiando en la escuela y colegio, tiene  un año de dedicarse a la venta de abarrotería como ser arroz, frijoles, azúcar, huevos, manteca, maíz, aceite, salsas y otros.
Doña Félix su negocio está ubicado en uno de los mercados de la ciudad donde miles de personas transitan por allí por lo que ya cuenta con clientes fijos, su actividad comienza a partir de las 6:00am hasta las 6:00pm, de Lunes a Domingo, su buena atención y la calidad de sus productos le permite que sus clientes le visiten diariamente.
Doña Félix está solicitando el prestamo para invertir en la compra de leches, quesos, arroz, azúcar, frijoles, pan, manteca, salsas, pastas, café, churros, refrescos y aguas para surtir su negocio
Doña Félix su sueño es que su negocio crezca y contar con bastantes clientes.


Tegucigalpa, Honduras - Noviembre del 2012
texts.en:
Félix lives in the city of Tegucigalpa with her husband and her three children, who are students.  She has been making a living for a year selling rice, beans, sugar, eggs, lard, corn, oil, sauces, and other groceries.

Félix's business is located in one of the city markets where thousands of people pass by, so she has regular customers.  She begins at 6 a.m. and works until 6 p.m., from Monday through Sunday.  Her customers visit her daily because of her good service and the quality of her products.

Félix is requesting a loan for 15,000.00 lempiras [HNL] to invest in buying milk, cheese, rice, sugar, beans, bread, lard, sauces, pasta, coffee, chips, beverages, and fruit juice to stock her business.

Félix's dream is that her business will grow and she'll have a lot of customers. 

Tegucigalpa, Honduras, November 2012

loans.use: to buy groceries for her business

loans.name: Inmaculada Concepcion De Qosqo Ayllu Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “INMACULADA CONCEPCION DE QOSQOAYLLU”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Calca, perteneciente a la provincia de Calca y departamento de Cusco.                                                                                                                                                                                             
La socia es la Sra. Paulina ella es conviviente y tiene 36 años y tiene 2 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de crianza de animales, la socia cría cuyes y chanchos, la socia los hace engordar y crecer y luego los vende en las diferentes ferias, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 4:00 p.m,la socia se dedica a este negocio 2 años y el está yendo bien, en sus tiempos libres a la socia le gusta salir a pasear con sus hijos , el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender  los animales. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar cuyes y chanchos y alimentos para los animales.
Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de ganado, negocio de venta de animales, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de venta de comida.

 
La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
These borrowers belong to the “INMACULADA CONCEPCION DE QOSQOAYLLU” ["Immaculate Conception of Qosqo Ayllu"] communal bank. This bank is located in the district of Calca, which belongs to the province of Calca, in the department of Cusco.
                                                                             
The featured borrower is Paulina. She is 36 years old, with a live-in partner and 2 children. She works in her business raising animals. She raises pigs and guinea pigs. She lets them grow and fatten up, and later she sells them in the various markets. She works from 8:00 a.m to 4:00 p.m, She has dedicated herself to this business for 2 years, and it is going well for her. In her free time, she likes to go out for walks with her children. Her dream is to have a sales stand where she can sell the animals. She is requesting the loan to buy pigs and guinea pigs, as well as feed for the animals. 

The other members dedicate themselves to businesses such as selling livestock, selling animals, running a grocery store, and selling food. 
 
This borrower is grateful to those who are participating in her dream through this mechanism, and she is committed to making her payments on schedule.

loans.use: to buy pigs and guinea pigs, as well as animal feed.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy products to stock her store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy shirts, blouses, pants, underpants, dresses, skirts, sandals and shoes. She will also buy pigs to slaughter

loans.name: Eleuterio

texts.es:
Don Eleuterio tiene 58 años de edad, esta acompañado y tiene cuatro hijos. Desde su niñez, se ha dedicado a la agricultura sus ingresos los recibe por la venta de los productos que cosecha. Esta actividad la desempeña con gran capacidad y experiencia por los años que tiene desarrollándola. A demás, posee una pequeña tienda instalada en su casa de la cual recibe otros ingresos y una granja de cerdos.

Los productos los compra en el pueblo más cercano que esta a ocho kilómetros de su vivienda, el acceso a ese lugar es bastante difícil debe caminar entre una hora a una hora y media; pues no llega transporte hasta ese lugar y el traslado de la mercadería es bastante complicado. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar azúcar, arroz, fríjol, aceite, entre otros productos de la canasta básica y otra parte para comprar alimento para sus cerdos. Con la inversión, podrá comprar mercadería en cantidades más grandes para no tener que viajar tan seguido y ahorrarse un dinerito por comprar al por mayor y con el alimento para sus cerdos, los podrá alimentar muy bien para venderlos en corto tiempo, cuando estén bien desarrollados.

Su deseo es mejorar su calidad de vida, para brindar a su familia, salud, educación, vestuario, alimentación. En la medida en que su negocio mejore lo podrá lograr; además pretende proporcionar el estudio a sus hijos, ya que a él no se le presento esa oportunidad.
texts.en:
Eleuterio is 58 years old and has four children. Since his childhood, he has been dedicated to agriculture and has earned his income through the sale of his harvest. He preforms this activity with great ability and experience developed over the years. He also has a small shop in his home which provides income as well as a pig farm.

The products are bought in a nearby town 8 kilometer from his home. Access to the town quite difficult and to walk it takes between and hour and an hour and a half. Since he does not have his own transportation, the transfer of merchandise is quite complicated.

He is requesting this loan from Fundación Campo to buy sugar, rice, beans, oil, and other staples, and to buy food for his pigs. With the investment, he will be able to buy merchandise in large quantities and avoid having to travel so often. He will also save money by purchasing the pig feed at wholesale. He will be able to feed them well and sell them in a short time, when they are developed.

His desire is to improve his quality of life, to provide for his family and their health, education, clothing, and food. As his business improves, he will be able to achieve this. He aims to provide his children the chance to go further in school, as he was not given the opportunity.

loans.use: to buy sugar, rice, beans, oil, and other staples and to buy food for his pigs.

loans.name: Maria Alejandra

texts.es: La señora Maria Alejandra, habitante del municipio de Ticuantepe,  junto a su esposo, trabajan duro para poder mantener su  hogar y darle buenas condiciones a su hijo, uno se sus mayores sueños es terner su casi bonita, su dificultas es que no pueden recaudar todo el dinero de u na sola vez para comprar materiales, pero Gracias a Afodenic y Fondos Kiva quienes les han brindado apoyo comprara los siguientes Materiales: Arena, Piedrin, Cemento, Bloques, Hierro,etc. Agradecen el apoyo y confianza que se les esta brindando con este credito.
texts.en:
Maria Alejandra lives in the municipality of Ticuantepe with her husband. She works hard to keep up her home and to provide good conditions for her child. One of her greatest dreams is to have a pretty home. This has been difficult because they could not raise all of the money at once to buy materials.

Thanks to Afodenic and Kiva funds, they will be able to buy the following materials: sand, gravel, cement, blocks, iron, etc. They are grateful for the support and confidence that is being offered with this loan.

loans.use: to buy materials for construction.

loans.name: Rosseli Glend

texts.es:
Rosseli is a 30 year old woman who lives in Nazca, Peru. Nazca is the home of the famed Nazca Lines, some of the most impressive geoglyphs in the world, and the desert region boasts plenty of other cultural attraction. Rosseli is very hard-working to support herself and her seven year old son. In her spare time, Rosseli enjoys drawing and likes graphic design.

In Nazca, she works in a printing shop that has services for all paper needs, including stationary design, and even embroiders polo shirts. She is very knowledgeable in her trade and is excellent at recruiting clients. She has asked for a loan so that she may buy extra polo shirts for a Christmas campaign. The extra income from selling these shirts can help Rosseli achieve her dream of owning his own print and design shop.
texts.en:
Rosseli is a 30 year old woman who lives in Nazca, Peru. Nazca is the home of the famed Nazca Lines, some of the most impressive geoglyphs in the world, and the desert region boasts plenty of other cultural attraction. Rosseli is very hard-working and supports herself and her seven year old son. In her spare time, Rosseli enjoys drawing and likes graphic design.

In Nazca, she works in a printing shop that has services for all paper needs, including stationary design, and even embroiders polo shirts. She is very knowledgeable in her trade and is excellent at recruiting clients.

She has asked for a loan so that she may buy extra polo shirts for a Christmas campaign. The extra income from selling these shirts can help Rosseli achieve her dream of owning his own print and design shop.

loans.use: to buy more polos for stamping and embroidery for the Christmas campaign.

loans.name: Mayra Petrona

texts.es:
La señora Mayra, vive en la ciudad de Tegucigalpa, es soltera y  vive con sus hijos que ya están casados, desde hace quince se dedica a la elaboración y venta de tortillas, que prepara en su casa y luego a partir de las 11:00 am ella instala su negocio en la entrada principal de un mercado de la ciudad.
